You can visit www.vfxlearning.com and see it for yourself. We also have a great Facebook community I'm devoted to this so I'm always available to answer any questions via email , the comments section or Skype. Ask and you shall receive :)
The Impact
If we are successful all of our contributions will give that kid in India or China, South America, Europe or Africa who sits and watches is awe how Iron Man and The Avengers save the world, or how Harry Potter defeats evil with so many cool tricks and spells, an opportunity to learn how this impressive imagery is done, and hopefully become the next generation of VFX Artists that with an open mind and warm heart will take our troubled and sometimes unfair industry into the place it deserves.
I hope that that other competitors of VFX Learning who have copied our method in the past will then follow us on this initiative. Is not easy to be the first in the water with this type of things, it changes dramatically the current paradigm and not everyone understands or agrees, but at least something is being done.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Don't worry if you cant contribute, you can help me immensely by spreading the word, tell everyone about this initiative so they can do the same. We all love movies so I'm sure someone you know will feel identified with my cause.
Also if any artists would like to contribute with course material, tutorials, etc please feel free to contact me.
If any VFX post-production houses, studios or software developers would like to participate in this project also feel free to drop me a line.
Thank you so very much for reading this long text and for your support.

story:
THE IMPACT

  • Do you know that about 55% of students go through college without knowing what career path to follow?
  • Do you know that an average student and their family have a student loan debt of at least $10,000 on the low end and into +$100K?
  • Do you know that youth unemployment is the highest it has ever been and paradoxically, there are millions of entry skilled level jobs that go unfilled every year?

Who are We?

McCloud Advisors (www.McCloudAdvisors.com) are an advisory platform that supports students as they make life changing decisions.  We are an online Education and Career advisory platform that seeks to provide advisory support to all students both in formal and informal education systems.  McCloudAdvisors are drawn from the professional and academic ranks and thus are able to provide current and forward looking advise to students.  

Your investment will be used to:

(1) To further develop the site to ensure tight secure communication and make it more interactive ($1500)

(2) provide incentives for the advisors for their time and effort ($1000)

(3) We realize that in order for the students in the developing world to take advantage of this opportunity, they need the basic infrastructure - a computer.  We have begun shipping computers that we bought from University Surplus Auctions to African elementary schools.  We want to "start them early" and make them ready to consume digital information.  It's a costly venture to ship and we need your help! ($1000)

 

What Motivates McCloudAdvisors?

It is well known that access to education is the key to success in this era of knowledge based economies but access without support in the form of advising is not enough.  At McCloudAdvisors, we believe in opportunity.

 "Access to education without support is not opportunity"

Is Education = Opportunity?  

If yes,

-then why is it that today's youth - the most educated of any youth group before it, are the most unemployed of all the other generations before it?  

 "Access to education without support is not opportunity"

If not,

-then what is missing in this formula?

Our simple formula is:

Education + Support = Opportunity

 

Please click on the link and view an animation that captures what we do,  http://youtu.be/COIStxpz2I4

story:
Note from Bryanna

My name is Bryanna. I live in California. I'm a 10 year old student currently attending Janie P. Abbott Elementary. I consider myself an explorer, and most of all I love discovering new things at museums. Some places I've been to are the Autry, the Kid space Museum, the Discovery Science Center, the Aquarium, the LA zoo, the Observatory, and so much more.

I am here because my wish is to take a trip to Washington D.C with students on a World Strides Discover Now program. It's a program that gives students like me an opportunity to discover and learn about America's history and government firsthand. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me to go on such an amazing and life-changing trip. I would love to go on this trip, but I can't because my parents are not able to afford this trip. So, I need your help to make my dream trip happen. You can donate little by little to help me with my goal. Please, pretty Please!! I will appreciate even the tiniest donation. I thank you in advance from the bottom of my heart. So, help my wish come ALIVE!!  

How can you help Bryanna?

First, please don't feel that financial contribution is the only way to help us. There are many other ways you can help. For example, you can share this page on your Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus or any other social media. Every little bit of financial assitance will us to achieve our goal. The estimated cost of the program is $2980 all fees included.

Preparing future leaders

One of our nation's founding principles is the power of the people, which is declared in the first three words of the Constitution, “We the people …”. It is with this principle in mind that we reach out to you to help us prove that the people still hold the power. We're faced with the fact that not all of us can afford the cost of this trip and we're not going to let that stop us. That's why we need your help.

story:
This portion of our ongoing campaign was moved from indiegogo/down4u to better focus and extend our efforts. Contributions can be made in both campaigns. We have had 20 supporters contribute $1083 so far.

 

Currently, within the Down syndrome community there are no National Level subscription based publications in circulation catering to families, educators, community leaders, medical providers, foundations, or associations and we would like to change that and get copies into every Doctors office in America and abroad. With almost 10 years of experience publishing we have the necesary processes in place to ensure our success. We can now easily accomplish this goal by January of 2013 with your help. we could even get issues into some of the big-box chain stores!

Share Your Story!

Are you the proud parent of a child, grandchild, or friend with Down syndrome? Do you have a blog or monthly newsletter within your organization? We want to help you get your stories published and into the mainstream public! More than anything we hope to change the hearts of Medical Providers and potential parents who has received a diagnosis that their child may be born with Down syndrome. We are looking to add writers, researchers, Mom's & Dad's, siblings, and especially Self-Advocates and other individuals with Down syndrome who can articulate their life experiences and help us bring the DS community closer together on a level never available before! Be sure to visit our website (in development) over the next few weeks (we will post regular updates right here) where you will be able to get more information and learn how you can be a part of this great project!

A Perfect Gift!!

Our magazine will make a perfect gift for your friends or loved ones. If you know someone who has a child with Down syndrome or who works in a field of medicine that would benefit from having a subscription, please take advantage of this opportunity and buy them a gift! As a contributor you are making it possible for us to accomplish something completely unexpected by hundreds of thousands of amazing families!

Send Subscriptions To Your Local Doctors Offices!!

Help us reach our Medical Professionals! If you are inspired by this opportunity but don't know anyone within the Down syndrome community, you can still help us!! We want to reach as many doctors' offices, gynecologists, hospitals, caregivers, and the like! So go grab your phone book, call your friends, and let's get this done!!!

Advertisers!

Are you a company, business owner, or product manufacturer that would benefit from reaching 15,000+ families, educators, politicians, and medical providers? This is your opportunity to secure a "Founding" position as an advertiser! Purchase/Sponsor subscriptions in bulk right here to get started!

Affiliates!!

We would love to help support your organization and provide you with an amazing vehicle for reaching families throughout the country. Sponsor in bulk and get them to your members! Together we can make this a reality!

Partners/Sponsors!!

We want to become a partner with your organization and provide you with an amazing vehicle for reaching families throughout the country and adding your voice to ours. Join us and help mold the conversations and messages. Sponsor in bulk and get them to your members. Together we can change hearts!

 Here's How Possible This Is With Your Contribution!

  • With just 1000 subscribers we can print our first two issues.
  • We plan to print every other month to start; 6 issues a year.
  • 3000 subscribers will ensure our first years success.
  • 6000 subscribers will make it possible to print every month!
  • We plan to print at least 15,000 copies of each issue.
  • We will be USPS “Periodical Compliant”.
  • 10,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 20,000 per month, distribute to box stores, and create our smartphone app.
  • 20,000 subscribers will make it possible to print 50,000 per month.
  • Again, one of our primary goals is to get each issue into as many doctors offices as possible.
We are looking for Angels, Founding Sponsors, Partners, Affiliates, Advertisers, Grandparents, and Businesses that would like to help us by sponsor subscriptions in bulk!

If you would like to participate, here’s how you can help & ensure our success.
  • Become a DST Angel by sponsoring 1000 subscriptions.
  • Become a Founding/Sponsor and pre-order 500 subscriptions.
  • Become a Mission Partner and pre-order 100 subscriptions.
  • Become an Affiliate and pre-order 10-50 subscriptions for your members.
  • Grandparents! order 5 issues as gifts for your extended family!

Become a Founding Business Sponsor @ enjoy a 30% placement discount. (Periodical Compliant)

  • “Full Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 421 issues
  • “Half Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 221 Issues
  • “Quarter Page, Six Issues” Sponsor 121 Issues

Contributions Can Be Tax Deductable.

Please consult a tax advisor.

___________________________________________________________________

WHY IS ALMOST EVERYTHING IN HERE ASSOCIATED WITH THE NUMBER 21?

The 21st Chromosome is one of 23 pairs found in us humans. People normally have two copies of this chromosome. The trisomy of the 21st chromosome (an extra little guy that's attached) causes Down Syndrome. Chromosome 21 is the smallest human chromosome, 47 million nucleotides (the building material of DNA) and representing about 1.5 percent of the total DNA in cells.

In 2000, researchers working on the Human Genome Project announced that they had determined the sequence of base pairs that make up this chromosome. Chromosome 21 was the second human chromosome to be fully sequenced. Pretty cool eh!

___________________________________________________________________

story:
Helping Underserved Students Succeed!  

Urban Scholar Athletes (U.S.A.), a project of Community Partners, is a non-profit, community-based organization located in Los Angeles, California. Our mission is to transform the live of urban youth through academic enrichment, athletics, and community service opportunities.

Beginning in Fall 2012, U.S.A’s emerging program, Urban Scholar Saturday Enrichment Academy,  has provided opportunities for over fifty underserved youth in grades 1st-6th to enhance their knowledge of California standards in Math, Reading, and Science. Through fun & engaging activities provided by certified teachers, Scholar Buck incentives, enrichment field-trips, and free books & magazines, academy students were given the opportunity to develop critical thinking skills, make connections to the real-world, and develop self-confidence in their learning ability within the regular classroom setting.  Our thirty-week program also served as a platform for students to develop habits of volunteerism and a sense of social responsibility and civic awareness through community service opportunities. 

As a result of the program’s success, both parents and scholars alike have reported a positive impact in the regular school setting and an improvement in self-esteem & social skills. What began with a vision to transform the lives of urban youth, has now grown into a high merit program that is striving to expand its impact to over 100 scholars for the 2013-2014 academic year!

Here's How You Can Help to Make a Difference: 

We are hoping to raise $7,000 to cover the cost of students' program fees, curriculum for multiple grade levels, books and magazines to promote literacy, enrichment field trips, and healthy snacks for our budding scholars. Ultimately, through your generosity, our urban scholars will be able to receive the support and skills necessary to achieve academic and social excellence to better themselves and their community. Below are some ways you can help the youth in Los Angeles.

Senior Academy Level: $3,000

Your gift of $3,000 will pay for the program fees of eight students; and the curriculum, snacks, and fieldtrips for all three academic terms--Fall, Winter, and Spring. In return for your donation, you will receive: 

  • Company logo or individual’s name will be placed on academy t-shirts, promotional banners, and fliers.
  • Business signage in academy classrooms.

  • Lead sponsor recognition in all press releases and other public relations efforts.

  • Recognition on Urban Scholar Athletes’website & social media pages with linked company logo.

  • Four high-quality academy t-shirts.
  • A recognition plaque to be hung in your place of business/home.
  • Urban Scholar Swag Pack (Pencil, Sticky Note & Keychain) & Water Bottle

Junior Academy Level: $1,500

Your gift of $1,500 will pay for the program fees of six students; and the curriculum, snacks, and fieldtrips for two terms (Fall, Winter, Spring). In return for your donation, you will receive:

  • Company logo or individual’s name will be placed on academy t-shirts, promotional banners, and fliers.

  • Business signage in academy classrooms.

  • Sponsor recognition in all press releases and other public relations efforts.

  • Recognition on Urban Scholar Athletes’ website & social media pages with linked company logo.

  •  Three high-quality academy t-shirts.

  •  A recognition plaque to be hung in your place of business/home. 

  • Urban Scholar Swag Pack (Pencil, Sticky Note & Keychain) & Water Bottle

Sophomore Academy Level: $500

Your gift of $500 will pay for the program fees of three students; and the snacks & field-trips for one term (Fall, Winter, Spring). In return for your donation, you will receive: 

  • Business signage in academy classrooms

  • Sponsor recognition in all press releases and other public relations efforts

  • Recognition on Urban Scholar Athletes’ website & social media pages with linked company logo.

  • Two high-quality academy t-shirts.

  • A recognition plaque to be hung in your place of business/home. 

  • Urban Scholar Swag Pack (Pencil, Sticky Note & Keychain) & Water Bottle

Freshman Academy Level: $250

Your gift of $250 will pay for the program fees of two students and the snacks for one term (Fall, Winter, Spring). In return for your donation, you will receive:

  • Sponsor recognition in all press releases and other public relations efforts
  • Recognition on Urban Scholar Athletes’ website & social media pages with linked company logo (if applicable) 
  • One high-quality academy t-shirt
  • A framed 4 x 6 photograph of academy students to be hung in your place of business/home
  • Urban Scholar Swag Pack (Pencil, Sticky Notes & Keychain) & Water Bottle

Friend of the Academy Level: $175

Your gift of $175 will pay for the program fees and Scholastic Weekly Magazine subscriptions of two students. In return for your donation, you will receive:

  •  Recognition on the Urban Scholar Athletes’ website & social media pages with liked company logo.
  • A 4 x 6 Photograph of Academy Students
  • One high-quality academy t-shirt [indiegogo supporters only]
  • Urban Scholar Swag Pack (Pencil, Sticky Notes, and Keychain)  

Valedictorian Level: $100 

Your gift of $100 will pay for the program fees of one student. In return for your donation, you will receive:

  • Acknowledgement and recognition on all Urban Scholar Athletes social media and website.
  • Urban Scholar Academy Swag Pack ( Pencil, Sticky Notes & Keychain)
  • A 4 x 6 Photograph of Academy Students 

Dean's List: $50

Your gift of $50 will pay for academic supplies (pencils, paper, etc.). In return for your donation, you will receive:

  • Acknowledgement and recognition on all Urban Scholar Athletes social media and websites.
  • Urban Scholar Academy Swag Pack ( Pencil, Sticky Notes & Keychain)

Honor Roll: $25

Your gift of $25 will pay for Scholar Buck Incentive prizes or the Scholastic Weekly Magazine subscription of five students. In return for your donation, you will receive:

  • Acknowledgement and recognition on all Urban Scholar Athletes social media and websites.
  • Urban Scholar Athletes' pencil

Honorable Mention: $5

Your gift of $5 will pay for the Scholastic Weekly Magazine subscription for one student. In return for your donation, you will receive: 

  • Acknowledgement and recognition on all Urban Scholar Athletes social media and websites.

Urban Scholar Saturday Enrichment Academy is a program worthy of your support. Please help low-income students participate in a program that will serve as a springboard for developing stronger comprehension, self-confidence, and a sense of pride. Make a difference today!

story:
We can make a difference in children's lives by improving their play spaces! 

THE LAST DAY TO GIVE IS MARCH 31! DON'T WAIT, GIVE TODAY!

Here is what your donation will do:

Help a teacher - teachers spend all day focused on children. This project will make their classroom into the dream space they've always wanted it to be. See Kristy in the pilot video on our You Tube channel. She was close to tears after the makeover and so were we. It was a dream come true! 


This project enhanced math and science learning, literacy development, dramatic (pretend) play, and art appreciation; skills needed for future school success!

GIVE TODAY!


Imagine your favorite design show happening in an early childhood classroom.

Last summer we worked with a group of dedicated volunteers and a shoestring budget to create the pilot video of “Make a Difference: One Play Space at a Time,” (See it on You tube: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ksT2j9SUA8&feature=share&list=UUORs5Lvatnhq4FueDKUL9TQ&index=2 ). The preschool teacher we worked with expressed such emotion in that video that it brought tears to our eyes. She said it would make a difference for the children, and she was right.

So many children were affected in a positive way by this project. After the makeover, other teachers in that child care center began to make positive changes on their own and even more teachers throughout our area began to call and share their own stories of how they made improvements to their play spaces, having been inspired by the video. The impact was on more than just one little play space and one small group of children, the community benefited and teachers became inspired!

Please help us do it again in three more child care programs!

No amount is too small to make a difference. Please GIVE and SHARE through your social networks to help increase this campaign’s visibility on IndieGoGo!

The Project

The Making a Difference: One Play Space at a Time web series will transform three local early childhood classrooms into engaging play spaces where children can thrive and grow. Just like your favorite design show on TV, the makeover will be filmed and made into a web series. Our goal is that this series will be an educational tool to inspire caregivers everywhere!

What We Know

Forty-two percent of children under age 5 with employed mothers spent at least 35 hours a week in child care.* (from urban.org). 75% of brain growth and 85% of intellect, personality, and social skills develop by age 5. Well-planned environments encourage children to explore, discover, wonder, create, and be curious. These quality early experiences lay the foundation for success later in life.

story:
What's 826NYC?

826NYC is a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting students ages 6-18 with their creative and expository writing skills, and to helping teachers inspire students to write.  We provide drop-in tutoring, field trips, writing based workshops, in-schools tutoring, help for English language learners, and assistance with student publications. All of our free programs are challenging and enjoyable, and ultimately strengthen each student's power to express ideas effectively, creatively, confidently, and in his or her individual voice.

We even have a superhero store--Brooklyn Superhero Supply Company.

Our Summer Filmmakers workshop is just one of the ways we encourage youth to engage in creative writing to find and express their voice.

Why We Need Your Help

Providing free programming to countless students year-round is no easy task and doesn't come cheap. Lucky for us, we have an army of amazing volunteers willing to share their talents! However, to make our film program the best it can be and begin to expand the program to engage more teens, we need funds for new equipment, staff time, space rental, DVDs for each of our filmmakers, and their official film posters. In addition to financing the workshops, the funds raised would support our annual student film fest, Erasers for Breakfast, on September 14!

What we'd like:

*One Canon EOS 5D 12.8 MP Digital SLR Camera, with Sigma 24-70 mm f/2.8 IF EX DG HSM AF Standard Zoom Lens. In addition to being the top-of-the-line camera for summer filmmakers, this camera would be used to record workshops, field trips, events, and readings.

*Two canon EOS Rebel T3i 18 MPs SLR Camera, with Sigma 24-70 mm f/2.8 IF EX DG HSM AF Standard Zoom Lens. In addition to being used in the summer filmmaker program, these cameras would be utilized by students in other 826NYC workshops.

* 4 Rode shotgun microphones.

* 4 boom and mic sets.

* Posters for each short  film.

* Exclusive Erasers for Breakfast 2014 t-shirts for our students designed by the amazing folks at CBX branding agency.

* Well designed and packaged DVDs for each student.

Our Track Record

For the past 7 summers, 826NYC students have gathered at our two centers to create close to 30 short films. Working with trained volunteers and industry professionals our students have consistent turned out well made, humorous shorts that we proudly screen at the Brooklyn Academy of Music's Rose Cinemas. We have helped inspire students like Alex, featured in the short above, to make a career in film their life's work. It's a goal he's taking seriously, building his portfolio with 826NYC and other organizations. 

He and the students featured in the embedded clips are just some of the young people we've helped inspire.


Ways You Can Help Build the Program

Supporting this program is as easy as 1, 2, 3. 

1. Pledge your support at any amount.

2. Share your support on Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit. 

3. Stay involved. Sign up for our newsletter to learn about others way you can support 826NYC, including volunteering for future programs.

In addition to being the top-of-the-line camera for summer filmmakers, this camera would be used to record workshops, field trips, events, and readings. *Two canon EOS Rebel T3i 18 MPs SLR Camera, with Sigma 24-70 mm f/2.8 IF EX DG HSM AF Standard Zoom Lens. In addition to being used in the summer filmmaker program, these cameras would be utilized by students in other 826NYC workshops. * 4 Rode shotgun microphones. * 4 boom and mic sets. * Posters for each short  film.* Exclusive Erasers for Breakfast 2014 t-shirts for our students designed by the amazing folks at CBX branding agency.* Well designed and packaged DVDs for each student.Our Track RecordFor the past 7 summers, 826NYC students have gathered at our two centers to create close to 30 short films. Working with trained volunteers and industry professionals our students have consistent turned out well made, humorous shorts that we proudly screen at the Brooklyn Academy of Music's Rose Cinemas. We have helped inspire students like Alex, featured in the short above, to make a career in film their life's work. It's a goal he's taking seriously, building his portfolio with 826NYC and other organizations. He and the students featured in the embedded clips are just some of the young people we've helped inspire. Ways You Can Help Build the Program
Supporting this program is as easy as 1, 2, 3.  1. Pledge your support at any amount.2. Share your support on Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit. 3. Stay involved. Sign up for our newsletter to learn about others way you can support 826NYC, including volunteering for future programs.

story:
Anaphylaxis First Aid Training Is A Must

The top allergy bloggers and advocates throughout Canada and the USA showed their support for our training fundraising initiative by appearing in our campaign video titled "Anaphylaxis First Aid Training Is A Must". Please click on the image above to view it. The script reads:

I support mandatory anaphylaxis first aid training and mandatory epinephrine kits in schools and daycares, and in all other places allergic people go. 

An allergic emergency  can happen anywhere, and for 25% of the victims, they will not know they have allergies. 

Restaurants, cafeterias, and food courts.

Dental offices, corporate offices, and even banks.

Daycares, schools, summer camps, campgrounds, and at universities.

School buses, airplanes and airports, bus terminals, and train stations. 

Gyms, community centers, and arenas.

Group homes, jails and prisons, and shopping malls.  

Hotels, resorts, and cruise ships, ALL need to be prepared to respond to an allergic emergency.

Why do I support this? 

I support this because every year, about 1,500 people worldwide die from improperly treated allergic shock, anaphylaxis. Carrying an EpiPen and knowing how to use it is often not enough to save lives. Some people die with EpiPens still in their pocket, there’s much more to know.

When to act.

How to act.

What to do next to preserve life, in the precious moments before it’s too late.

Every 6 minutes, someone with anaphylaxis  arrives at the emergency room. Sometimes it’s too late to save them. Without proper first aid BEFORE the ambulance comes, anaphylaxis can kill perfectly healthy children and adults, only because they were allergic.

One life lost is too many.

Enough is enough.

Let’s do something about this.

Anaphylaxis First Aid training is a must. 

Don’t Delay. Don’t let another person slip away.

For my daughter, Maia, who died from anaphylaxis in a shopping mall food court. Let that be enough. 

For my son B.J. , who died at a vacation resort. Let that be enough. 

The death of Katelyn, 

the death of Ammaria,

the death of Sabrina,

the death of  Megann, 

who all died at school from their allergies. Let that be enough.

Too many lives lost already.

Enough is enough.

Don’t let another person slip away.

Anaphylaxis First Aid training is a must.

Our Work

To fill the gap between Allergists and their patients, I created Onespot Allergy Blog five years ago, and I've become the leading voice worldwide speaking to allergy safety and legal issues. My news feed fills up far too frequently with news of allergic injury and death, and I realized that there is a huge gap in the quality and consistency of allergy first aid training, so I partnered with Allergist Dr. Mark Greenwald and we created an online anaphylaxis first aid course. Our hope is to help prevent the 1,500 lives lost worldwide each year to anaphylaxis by teaching the most prudent anaphylaxis first aid. 

Allergy advocacy groups normally seek donations and grants, and then offer "free" resources on their websites. We did not seek or receive any funding for the course, we funded it ourselves. I devoted myself full time to its creation, it took 9 months to complete, and our course is now live at www.epipentraining.com. Each person trained completes the course on his or her own computer, and it takes less than one hour to complete. 

We made the course premium quality with actors depicting all the stages of allergy rescue so our users feel well rehearsed and totally prepared after taking the course, there are quizzes throughout it to ensure the content is mastered, and it's backed by an extremely powerful learning management system so we can train 1 person or 100,000 people at a time. We don't just teach how to activate an EpiPen, the curriculum of our course covers:

  • All the symptoms of an allergic reaction to watch for, as many symptoms are overlooked
  • Exactly when to use epinephrine (1 symptom? 2 symptoms? certain symptoms only?)
  • Is there any reason not to use epinephrine?
  • Do antihistamines have a place in anaphylaxis first aid?
  • How to position the injection and the patient's body for the best absorption
  • Exactly when to re inject
  • How to monitor the patient medically until emergency crews arrive including a review of CPR, and 
  • Legal liability. 
A snippet of our course is below.


Our course has been live for seven months, and we notice that the parents of allergic children are taking the course themselves, then they're buying the course for their entire daycare staff and school staff to take. They're bearing this expense themselves, and this is too much of a financial burden for many families to bear. We would like to take that burden off allergy parents by providing the course for free to educators in the USA and Canada, but we need your help to do so, as there is a cost every time the course is taken. With your help, you can ease the burden on these parents and provide teachers and caregivers with the best quality and most current anaphylaxis rescue training. 

The feedback about our training course has been excellent. Here is what some of our users have written:

I'm excited to be able to share your training program with family, friends, and the staff at my son's school. I found the information to be easily understood and helpful. No one who finishes this training can walk away without feeling more empowered to use an EpiPen. It is so important that everyone around a food allergic person be confident in that decision and this program really shows how the EpiPen is the only solution for anaphylaxis. Even after 7 years of living with a food allergic child I feel more prepared after completing your training. Thank you for providing me with another tool to keep my son and others like him safe. - Katie M.

Thank you EpiCenter Medical for providing an exceptional course about anaphylaxis management. This course WILL SAVE LIVES!… Considering I am an RN, who has managed ICU, ER and Critical Care-I didn’t expect to “learn” anything. Rather, I thought I would use this course to teach those who care for my daughter. Well, I am 100% positive that my own daughter is more safe today because I took this course. My husband, who is a physician, is also eager to take the course. - Tricia G

Today is my son’s first day at preschool. It is the first day he has been left alone with anyone outside of our own family. He was diagnosed with multiple life threatening food allergies at the age of 18 months and because of that fact, this is the day I have been dreading for a very long time. We have taken every precaution possible and I feel very comfortable with the teachers, however I really needed to know that they had all the knowledge and preparation possible to deal with an anaphylactic emergency. I purchased several EpiCenter Medical training courses for the director of the preschool and the teachers. I feel this course gave them the knowledge and the confidence to properly care for my son and other children who have life threatening food allergies. My worst fears have been that a teacher might not recognize anaphylaxis or might be afraid to treat him quickly. This course addresses how to recognize anaphylaxis and also emphasizes the importance of treating quickly and properly. The amount and depth of knowledge that the course provides was actually shocking. I know that when I took the course I learned some new information as well! The director of the school felt that the information helped the staff tremendously and she has now purchased the course for the entire staff. I have always believed that the best way to keep my son safe is through education and knowledge. Thank you so much EpiCenter Medical for providing a very effective, thorough and accurate way to educate others about keeping my son safe! Thank you for all that you do EpiCenter Medical to help parents, teachers and children stay safe and confidently prepared! ~ Suzanne and Kory V. 

I wanted to let you know that EpiCenter Epi-Pen online certification course did a great job in teaching me how to identify the symptoms of anaphylaxis and what to do should I encounter someone under distress. I had just previously completed the Pediatric and Adult First Aid/CPR/AED course offered by the American Red Cross, and was disappointed to find out they did not offer Epi-Pen certification in my area. I think knowing how to identify the symptoms of anaphylaxis and the use of the EpiPen was a crucial component missing from the America Red Cross course that I took. The videos and the tests that were provided in your course reinforced many important concepts, and I feel much more comfortable as to what to do in such a situation. I have ordered a training EpiPen to practice the skills that I learned on the videos. I also like the two page protocol printout that you provided with the course; I had it laminated and now it is a part of my first aid sheets that I carry around with me to every one of the college classes I teach. At first, I was very scared that I had to teach classes before the college nurse was on duty, but your course and the American Red Cross course has made me feel more empowered should an unfortunate medical emergency take place. I think that all college professors should have training in Epi-Pen, because college campus are large and the school nurse, depending on her location on campus, could take up to 15+ minutes to get on the scene, which from the Epi-Pen course, we know often is already too late to take action. ~ Melissa

My Funding Goal & What You Get

One licence for our course normally costs $30.00. 

For every $20 contributed to this campaign, I will provide two licences: One to train a teacher, AND ONE FOR YOU. If you contribute $40, I will provide training for two teachers, and you get two course codes to use yourself or distribute to a close friend, relative, or babysitter . And so on.... and so on. 

Your contribution pays for delivering the course to the teacher or caregiver, including the cost of our learning management provider and administration. If we reach $10,000 in funding, we can provide free training to 500 teachers and give out 500 course codes to our donors. You can even put your own school or daycare in touch with us, so we can contact them to offer our free training to them. 

If we don't reach our funding goal, we will provide free training for whatever number of educators our funding allows. If we exceed our goal, we will train even more educators, or open up the free course codes to other places allergic children go, like Boys & Girls Clubs, Y.M.C.A.s, Scout Troups, summer camps, and school bus lines. 

By contributing to Provide Free Anaphylaxis First Aid Training For Educators, you’ll ALSO help out even more good causes. 10% of the total proceeds you contribute will be donated in equal shares to three charities that we feel strongly about FARE, Kids With Food Allergies, and Anaphylaxis Canada. 

What is each charity's mission?

FARE works to ensure the safety and inclusion of individuals with food allergies through education, advocacy and awareness, and to seek a cure by supporting world-class research.

Kids With Food Allergies educates families about food allergy management, emergency preparedness and prevention, and partners on food allergy research studies.  By supporting their work, you help save lives and improve the quality of life for children and their families.

Anaphylaxis Canada provides education and support programs for both children and adults and advocates on behalf of allergic individuals to the government, medical community, airline, restaurant and other industries, and supports research into the causes and potential cures for anaphylaxis.

The Impact

Every year, about 1,500 lives are lost worldwide to improperly treated allergic reactions. Other victims suffer allergic injury like coma or brain damage. Most of these losses are preventable with proper anaphylaxis first aid. By training yourself and your child's teachers and caregivers with the most comprehensive and up to date first aid course, you can close the gaps in first aid care that victims fall through year after year.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help with funding will make a difference, not only because educators and caregivers will be trained to properly provide anaphylaxis first aid, but because you will be trained too. If you can't contribute, you can still help by sharing this campaign by e-mail, Facebook, and Twitter with your contacts. As we say in our campaign video: "One life lost is too many. Enough is enough. Let's do something about it. Anaphylaxis First Aid Training is a must."

story:
"Work Hard. Get Smart. Follow Your Big Heart." - Room 209 Mantra

Camp Campbell

Each year, thousands of fifth graders from all over the state of California make their annual class overnight trip to science camp. Here, tucked away in the woods (often for the first time away from their families) students get to experience up close and personal the ecosystems, biology and weather they have been studying for years leading up to this point. Science camp in an integral part of their success as scientists. College graduates still list 5th grade science camp as one of the pivotal moments that turned them on to science. With more than half of the hopeful students being female, this trip is of even greater importance for forming their identities as scientific thinkers. 

What We Need & What You Get

The cost for each student to attend science camp is $255. For some families, this may present challenges or even impossibilities. The teachers, staff and administration of Galarza Elementary firmly believe that no child should have to be turned away from this experience due to lack of funds.

We have spoken with parents. We have heard their concerns. We have tried creative budgeting. The money is just not there. We need your help.

With this funding, we hope to create an account to help meet the gaps for families of the 90 5th grade scientists. With your help, we could offer each family the rest of the money they need to send their child to camp.

Any amount as small as $1 will help get our students to camp, but there are a few perks to making a donation, too.

-For a donation of $20 or more, you will receive a hand-written letter from the child which you sponsored once they return from science camp in March.

-For a donation of $50 or more, you will receive a hand-written letter from the student you helped after science camp, plus a link to a video message from our time spent together at science camp.

-For any donation $75 or more, you will receive a personalized letter a link to a video message from your student, as well as a special camp t-shirt personalized from the scholars you helped.

The Impact

Your participation in this fundraiser has the potential to change the outcomes of these children. Each year, students surrender educational opportunities like science camp due to funds. Meanwhile, their affluent counterparts in surrounding schools continue to move ahead. The opportunity gap widens. Our students fall behind. Please join us in ensuring this does not happen for these talented young scholars. 

Your help, however great or small your donation, does make a difference. It shows that someone they may not know cares. It shows them their education is important. It proves that there are those that aren't willing to let them fall behind.

Other Ways You Can Help

If making a monetary contribution doesn't make sense for you at this time, please consider sharing this link to our fundraising page. The more exposure this project gets, the greater our chances of getting these students to camp! 


Thank you so much for your consideration and investment in these students. We thank you on their behalf. 

-Ms. Brown, Mrs. Nevarez & Mr. Smith

"Work Hard. Get Smart. Follow Your Big Heart" - Room 209 Mantra

story:
My name is Denise Christopher.

Help me fund tuition & equipment for my dream archaeology dig.

    Help me photograph my life-long dream. I'm trying to raise funds to attend an Archaeological dig in Calif. to study rock-art and the only known Chumash Cache Cave having extensive perishable material remaining. I will learn how to use portable XRF and 3D laser scanning. Then I will be purchasing and using a Remote Controlled Multicopter to photograph out of reach petroglyph rock-art previously unseen.

 About Me...

   I spent most of my life working as a photographer and raising my beautiful Daughter but I always wondered what's out there. I love primitive rock-art. So I finally went back to college and now I'm a third year student at Northern Arizona University studying Anthropology/Archaeology. I have managed to get this far but now I need Field Experience. The funds I raise through your generous donations will pay for equipment (Multicopter) and my tuition. This is a summer Field Experience class through the Institute for Field Research in California and Connecticut College.

     http://www.ifrglobal.org/programs/n-america/u-s-wind-wolves

     http://www.conncoll.edu/

My Cause...

    This is my chosen field of research. Rock-art is being defaced, vandalized, and is quickly disappearing. Petroglyph images were used to show the way to game, water, religious sites and other villages. It was indispensable for the survival of roaming bands of archaic peoples. The importance of these sites can be noted in the name of  one National Monument called newspaper rock! Can there ever be anything more exciting than being one of the first to discover an unknown treasure of ancient artifacts in a hidden cave. There are so very few undiscovered rock-art caves left in the world. Help me discover this once in a career lifetime archaeological site.

 Where the Money will go...

   Of the funds I'm requesting $4,300.00 will pay the tuition for the 8 credit Field School. The remaining $2,200.00 will be used to purchase a Remote Controlled Multicopter that I will use throughout the Colorado Plateau to photograph and document petroglyph rock-art on high cliffs and inaccessible areas. I will cover gas, food, and lodging. I have already purchased over $5,000. in photographic equipment for this project.

So please, if you have ever wanted to go on a Treasure Hunt, help me get the word out to fund this project.

     If I don't reach my financial goal I'm going to use what is available from all you kind people who contributed to pay for just my tuition. Help me photograph works of art more than a thousand years old. Oh, and don't forget the Indiegogo share tools!

The Perks...

     The photographs listed in the Perks are Landscape and Rock-Art Photographs I will take using High-dynamic-range imaging.  (HDR) is a set of techniques used in imaging and photography to reproduce a greater dynamic range of luminosity than possible using standard digital imaging or photographic techniques. HDR images can represent more accurately the range of intensity levels found in real scenes, from direct sunlight to faint starlight, and is often captured by way of a plurality of differently exposed pictures of the same subject matter.

Thank you
story_txt:
My name is Denise Christopher.Help me fund tuition & equipment for my dream archaeology dig.
    Help me photograph my life-long dream. I'm trying to raise funds to attend an Archaeological dig in Calif. to study rock-art and the only known Chumash Cache Cave having extensive perishable material remaining. I will learn how to use portable XRF and 3D laser scanning. Then I will be purchasing and using a Remote Controlled Multicopter to photograph out of reach petroglyph rock-art previously unseen. About Me...    I spent most of my life working as a photographer and raising my beautiful Daughter but I always wondered what's out there. I love primitive rock-art. So I finally went back to college and now I'm a third year student at Northern Arizona University studying Anthropology/Archaeology. I have managed to get this far but now I need Field Experience. The funds I raise through your generous donations will pay for equipment (Multicopter) and my tuition. This is a summer Field Experience class through the Institute for Field Research in California and Connecticut College.      http://www.ifrglobal.org/programs/n-america/u-s-wind-wolves     http://www.conncoll.edu/
My Cause...     This is my chosen field of research. Rock-art is being defaced, vandalized, and is quickly disappearing. Petroglyph images were used to show the way to game, water, religious sites and other villages. It was indispensable for the survival of roaming bands of archaic peoples. The importance of these sites can be noted in the name of  one National Monument called newspaper rock! Can there ever be anything more exciting than being one of the first to discover an unknown treasure of ancient artifacts in a hidden cave. There are so very few undiscovered rock-art caves left in the world. Help me discover this once in a  career lifetime archaeological site. Where the Money will go...    Of the funds I'm requesting $4,300.00 will pay the tuition for the 8 credit Field School. The remaining $2,200.00 will be used to purchase a Remote Controlled Multicopter that I will use throughout the Colorado Plateau to photograph and document petroglyph rock-art on high cliffs and inaccessible areas. I will cover gas, food, and lodging. I have already purchased over $5,000. in photographic equipment for this project.So please, if you have ever wanted to go on a Treasure Hunt, help me get the word out to fund this project.      If I don't reach my financial goal I'm going to use what is available from all you kind people who contributed to pay for just my tuition. Help me photograph works of art more than a thousand years old. Oh, and don't forget the Indiegogo share tools!

 than possible using standard digital imaging or photographic 
techniques. HDR images can represent more accurately the range of 
intensity levels found in real scenes, from direct sunlight to faint 
starlight, and is often captured by way of a plurality of differently 
exposed pictures of the same subject matter.Thank you

story:
Help us support a young Bahamian interested in pursuing engineering!

Funds will also help us kick-start our 2014-2015 collection for STEM/arts/entrepreneurship/leadership scholarships in the Bahamas, Canada, and beyond! Stay tuned! :)

Contact info@myziribag.com with any questions or concerns!

 --

My name is D'Andre Wilson-Ihejirika and recently I had the honor of being recognized as a Woman Of Inspiration by Girls Inc. of Northern Alberta.

I am originally from Nassau, Bahamas and now live in Alberta, Canada. An engineer by background, I have recently started an initiative called BrainSTEM Alliance to raise awareness about STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math). As a part of this initiative I also wanted to encourage young women in particular to consider careers in STEM. I then founded Ziri Bags & Accessories, a company that produces fashion bags styled in ethnic prints that raise funds for scholarships and grants for young women.

What We Need & What You Get

2013 marked 40 years of Independence for the The Bahamas. Becuase of that I decided to launch my first Ziri line with a print inspired by the Bahamas. This print has blues and golds, which are colors of the Bahamas, with highlights of orange. This collection will specifically raise funds to support a young lady from the Bahamas who has interests in pursuing a degree in Engineering and has made an impact on her community.

 

We have 3 styles of bags:

Ziri Edge
A slim clutch with the edges detailed in the Bahama-style batik print. Available in black or brown leather.

Ziri Duo
A slim bag that doubles as both a clutch and a crossbody bag. Feather a unique stripe of Bahama-style batik print and is available in both brown and black leather.

 

Ziri Bold
A handbag with bold Bahama-style batik print. Comes with a over the shoulder strap and is available in both brown and black leather.

 

The Impact

Through BrainSTEM Alliance, I have run multiple engineering outreach programs in Canada and in the Bahamas, and I am currently running the second annual Girls Inc. of Northern Alberta SMART Program. (Science Math and Relevant Technology). From organizing and participting in these program, I have seen that young girls DO have an interest in pursuing STEM careers and will need all the support they can get! These bags will be a small part of that by providing some of these girls with scholarships, helping to fund future BrainSTEM Alliance programming, and creating more Ziri Bag fundraisers for future grants.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, and that's OK! Just help us spread the word through Facebook, Twitter and any other way you can!

Learn more about Ziri at www.myziribag.com

And check out my STEM consulting inititative at www.brainstemalliance.com

story:
Short Summary

Today, a record number of children face physical, verbal, social, and cyber bullying.

Unfortunately many of the cues to detect bullying are difficult to recognize, yet bullying has a profound impact on children’s lives.

We offer a revolutionary program that will help you bully-proof your child.

This effective program includes:

  1. A book that will teach you how to recognize the subtle cues of bullying
  2. A 45-minute DVD to develop your child’s self-protection skills in case of a physical attack
  3. An online self-confidence course that will teach your child how to boost self-confidence, the best defense against bullies

The products are ready to launch on TV commercials (see the video), and now we need your help to produce the inventory. Your contributions will help us create copies of the product for distribution.

What We Need & What You Get

We need US$10,000. This money will be used to produce 2,000 units of No Bully Fear's program.

If you contribute to this incredible project, we will give you a copy of No Bully Fear's program, which includes a book, a DVD, and access to an online course (see details above.)

We are ready for production, so you will get your copy very, very soon!

The Impact

Bullying is becoming is achieving epidemic proportions everywhere. Unfortunately most of the anti-bullying campaigns out there use the "stop bullying" slogan, which only speaks to the bullies and the bystanders. These campaigns don't speak to children who need it the most: the ones being bullied.

No Bully Fear strengthens the targets of bullying mentally and emotionally.

Join our efforts to help children all over the country overcome bullying.

This program has been successfully tested in various school systems. It has also won the "Parent Tested Parent Approved" winner award.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! Perhaps you don't need this program, now, but surely you know someone who does.

Share this project's link with your friends on Facebook and Twitter.

story:
I have a board game called caught up the intervention game i want to have the game developed into an app, so it can be used in  the school districts in the class room to bring a positive game to the young people around the world i'm hoping that people see the potential of this project and let us get it out.

the game has urban characters and its  played like chess ; the game has flip cards with positive affirmations and true life stories  

I have receive a lot of good reactions from young and old professional and everyday people, 

we have been invited to be on the school district vendors list as soon as we have more board games and apps.

We dont have the money to have the board game develop into app made to put on the school list or to make it playable on tablets that schools are using as well with the right backing. It will spread everywhere, I have been in business for my self and involve with young people and know and see the need of this game . my experience with people and working in my community gives m

Isaiah crompton

 Bakersfield, CA · 

As founder and director of Stop The Violence. I have found it necessary to put on a few more hats. I enjoy being part of these board/committee Keeping Bakersfield Beautiful, Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.Celebration, The African American Network, Clinica Sierra Vista, and I'm also a volunteer at the Food Bank. When I'm not helping to distribute food to the needy. I'm involved in one of many community activities that serve the underprivileged and those affected by violence throughout the community. Thank God for loving parents that taught me the importance of caring for others, because of there kind heart, generous spirit and I'm deeply embedded spiritually, I'm able to work with low income families, addicts and the homeless, to business, spiritual and civic leaders in our community. 
During the 18 plus years has been involved with the Partnership Food Bank and the executive director of stop the violence movement, I operate an Emergency Food Pantry and commodity distribution site to serve individuals in need, distributing to 1500 families each month. It is my goal to see Caught Up The Intervention Game App/Board game in every school, youth camp/program, and churches. I am also creating two more intervention games coming out next year.

Websites
  • caughtupthegame.wordpress.com

story:
Martin Luther King Jr. said, “Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter.”

What you should know about me: 
I grew up in Colorado but did not realize how fortunate I was for that opportunity until I spent 5 years going to college and working in Washington, DC. When I returned to Colorado 2 years ago, a wonderful friend of mine introduced me to climbing 14,000 foot peaks. A person's relationship with the natural environment will be forever changed once you spend two days in the middle of nowhere, struggling to summit the highest peaks in the country, breathing fresh mountain air, sleeping on rocks, drinking stream water and listening to the sound of birds and elk. These experiences have awakened me to the need to understand and protect our environment because I wish for everyone to have the same opportunities to experience its wonder. 

Recently I met a man who led a school district in Colorado to save $16 million on their electricity bills by implementing a student-run energy audit program. They put that money to better use for the students by creating new field trip opportunities, arts programs, college and work-place preparation training and more. This amazing example of leadership has inspired me to find a way to become a community leader too. 

What is The Institute for Compassionate Leadership and why am I a part of it? 
The Institute for Compassionate Leadership trains individuals with a passion for positive change to be leaders. ICL brings people from across the country to New York City to work together and support each other in all our varied interests for the betterment of our communities and lives.  The program will also connect me with a mentor who will guide me in the pursuit of my passion.
ICL is a leadership program that combines:
- my constant desire to learn new things, meet new people, and see new places.
- the drive to leave the world a better place than I found it.
- the practice of mindfulness and compassion which is so important for experiencing joy in life.
The money I raise through this campaign is for tuition costs for the Institute and travel costs for me to attend Institute events in New York City. 

Why should you fund me?
Do you believe in empowering the next generation to make positive change?
Do you believe in appreciating and protecting our environment? 
Do you believe in the power of compassion and mutual understanding? 
Do you believe in leadership for the betterment of community and humanity?
Do you believe in helping me help others?

If you answered yes, then you should fund me!! 

Other ways you can help:
If you can't afford to contribute any money to my campaign, you can easily help by spreading the word:
- email your friends and family, talk to people you know who might be interested in contributing to my campaign
- use the Indiegogo Share Tools on this page to tells others about my campaign

Wrap up:
I believe very strongly that climbing is a metaphor for life. The mountain looks enormous and un-walkable, and at times you can't even see the summit but if you simply continue to put one foot in front of the other you will eventually reach the top. On that note, I know times are tough and money is tight for everyone and it is not a particular comfortable feeling to be asking for any. However, even small amounts is helpful. Raising $7,000 is a challenge, but it is not impossible with your help and encouragement! I would be more than happy to talk with anyone who has questions or is interested in funding me. 

Thank you! 
To learn more about the Institute, visit their website: http://instituteforcompassionateleadership.org

I came to see that the mountains we conquer are not those on the horizon - supreme, cold, and taunting, but rather those within us: of fear, weakness, and ignorance. - Royal Robbins

story:
Get what you want at the price YOU want!

Shnipit - What's your save? 

Full Video coming soon !  

What it does for you!

To begin the potential of this mobile app is whatever your answer is to the above question! Traditional deal sites will email you any deal they find and send them to you. What if its not what you need?

  1. SUPERBOWL ? REQUEST A PIZZA, DRINKS, PAPER-VIEW, BURGER DEAL
  2. NIGHT OUT? REQUEST SUSHI, ITALIAN FOOD, STEAK HOUSE
  3. THIRSTY & BORED? REQUEST COFFEE, SMOOTHIE, BOWLING
  4. THE OFFERINGS ARE ENDLESS & UP TO YOU 
Instantly receive 90% OFF and all you do is purchase & redeem. 

Shnip around for deals, Shnip-it to your friends and if you want it then Shnipit!

What happens when you purchase a perk?

- Not only would it provide the funding needed for the app to allow college students, low income people, small businesses and people who provide services with more cash and to save on anything but WE HELP RUN SANDWICH RUNS, SHELTER OFFERINGS & SINCE ITS WINTER IMAGINE HOW THEY FEEL BEING OUTSIDE 24/7
We will set aside enough fund to buy simple things like Apples, juice boxes, granola bars and so forth. 
The beauty of this app is other companies commission businesses up to 60%. We do single digit AND of that big gap of savings why not put aside XX% for charities? We have such a platform for that! When customers purchase they choose their charity to donate to.

Check out for more information!

http://www.delivergood.org/charity/135/volunteers-needed 


Put a smile on peoples face and a save on expenses 

Unique features we will add - Send a deal gift to someone you like, love, appreciate with a voice or video message. The trick is they can't use the deal unless they see your WHOLE message. 

You can integrate your instagram App where if you happen to hashtag something we will find a deal for you from what you hashtaged! 


The Technical part:

Breaking it down for you!

  • We need a funding of $72k to get the whole app going 
  • This allows us to develop apps for both android & Iphones so we help more people by using this app
  • Most of the costs will be development related which are always more complex
  • SEO (search engine optimization) and a simplistic mobile design will be incorporated for easy use and to bring traffic in to the Site and App
  • We also provide charities and employee benefits to workers everywhere
  • If we don't reach our entire goal it will be upsetting because I truly believe people should decide what they want to buy and at what price not the other way around
  • Enjoy the perks & feel good about them! 

Perks from feeding the homeless, keeping them warm, bringing up their self image and at the same time knowing its a good cause.

Be a super hero this year and we will donate $5 for this perk purchase. This $5 will be enough to provide a meal for the homeless and to have extra cash. 


Super hero Iphone 5/5S cases



Keep your secrets in your handmade leather journal but also being a secret helper! Buy this perk and you will get an image of the homeless people you helped with name! 


Hand made leather journals


Custom Belgian made chocolate bars (check flavors)

We all know when its a bad time chocolate just seems to help! Well you helped and deserve a bite from our many flavors. $5 goes towards preparing meals for homeless. 


Creepy Plush friend 

Hug it out! All yours. 


Thanks again! Please share! <3





I have a lot of experience (4 years of it) in development for web/mobile and business. I have increased sales by 4 times as supervisor on the products we sell at Marble Slab Creamery.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far we more than kindly appreciate your time and would love for you to help us fund this idea to help save businesses and give discounts to everyone on anything! Use the share tools on Indiegogo and please like us on facebook.com/shnipit for more updates.

For support email @ shnipit@hotmail.com

And have yourself a one of a kind day : )

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Max Clouser I am a goalie for Sooke Minor Hockey.
  • My goal is to raise enough money to purchase new hockey equipment. my current equipment is too small and worn out.
  • If I continue to play hockey I could play NCAA and possibly earn a scholarship.

What I Need & What You Get

  • I need new equipment badly and will purchase a CCM 500 combo set, The total set is approximately $1400 including tax. The CCM 500 combo set is comprised of leg pads, glove, and blocker for ice hockey. These are very high quality pads that prevent injury and are very durable. The CCM 500 set is often used by professional hockey players including players in the NHL.


  • Rewards for contributors include: Hand written thank-you letter and signed photographs.
  • If I do not reach my entire goal, I will still purchase the equipment with money earned from my summer job at an ice hockey camp. It will just take me longer to save money and I may not get these leg pads, blocker, and glove in time for the 2014 hockey season. Any moneys I raise during this campaign I will put towards the purchase of this equipment.

The Impact

  • By helping me purchase the equipment that I desperately need, you can feel good about the fact that you are supporting an aspiring hockey players career.
  • This season I played Midget AA and I will be trying out for midget AAA this August of 2014.
  • I also will be working at an ice hockey camp this summer where I will help train younger hockey players including goalies. This will cause even more wear and tear on my current equipment.
  • I will be happy to send you a photograph of my current equipment which highlights its poor condition. Please contact me to request such if needed for your decision to contribute. The video above also shows the condition of my current equipment. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The only risk is if this particular set of CCM 500 goalie equipment sells out and goes out of stock. The simple solution to this is to purchase a different goalie equipment such as the Bauer Reactor 4000 combo.

      If You Are Unable To Contribute...

  • If you can not contribute yourself please spread the word around by sharing the link of this campaign with friends and family (Facebook,Email,Twitter, etc.)
  • Remember that Indiegogo has great share tools.

Short Summary 
My name is Max Clouser I am a goalie for Sooke Minor Hockey. My goal is to raise enough money to purchase new hockey equipment. my current equipment is too small and worn out. If I continue to play hockey I could play NCAA and possibly earn a scholarship.

  What I Need & What You Get I need new equipment badly and will purchase a CCM 500 combo set, The total set is approximately $1400 including tax. The CCM 500 combo set is comprised of leg pads, glove, and blocker for ice hockey. These are very high quality pads that prevent injury and are very durable. The CCM 500 set is often used by professional hockey players including players in the NHL.





Rewards for contributors include: Hand written thank-you letter and signed photographs. If I do not reach my entire goal, I will still purchase the equipment with money earned from my summer job at an ice hockey camp. It will just take me longer to save money and I may not get these leg pads, blocker, and glove in time for the 2014 hockey season. Any moneys I raise during this campaign I will put towards the purchase of this equipment. 
  The Impact 
By helping me purchase the equipment that I desperately need, you can feel good about the fact that you are supporting an aspiring hockey players career. This season I played Midget AA and I will be trying out for midget AAA this August of 2014.
I also will be working at an ice hockey camp this summer where I will help train younger hockey players including goalies. This will cause even more wear and tear on my current equipment. I will be happy to send you a photograph of my current equipment which highlights its poor condition. Please contact me to request such if needed for your decision to contribute. The video above also shows the condition of my current equipment.  
  Risks & Challenges The only risk is if this particular set of CCM 500 goalie equipment sells out and goes out of stock. The simple solution to this is to purchase a different goalie equipment such as the Bauer Reactor 4000 combo.
       If You Are Unable To Contribute... 
If you can not contribute yourself please spread the word around by sharing the link of this campaign with friends and family (Facebook,Email,Twitter, etc.) Remember that Indiegogo has great share tools.

story:
What is The Shanti Project's goal?

Honing in on the Bophas peoples' visions for their own lives and those of their children, The Shanti Project Income Generation Program is a direct response to community meetings we held in Jaisalmer in October and November of 2012 wherein the Bophis expressed their lack of means to provide for their families basic needs including but not limited to: education, housing, health care and nutritional deficits. The goal of the program is to equip them with jobs so that they can in turn equip their families. 

The Shanti Project's main marketing goal is to have a broad target market in the states and abroad to generate as much revenue as possible for the artisans currently involved, and so that we can expand to help other people. The Bophas will be producing sustainable crafts that lend a hand-up to the artisans who create them. The initial products that will be produced are bamboo flatware and up-cycled sari silk sleep sacks. We also have another line in the works that we are working on designs for that we hope to unveil soon.

The Shanti Project works with marginalized caste members between the ages of 14 and 60. Some demographic information that is relevant: 

>10% have schooling through sixth grade 

> 70% live in tarped structures/tents

> 80% struggle with food costs

>100% have a dream...

How did this project come to be?

The Shanti Project is a grassroots 501c3 organization that formed after a 2009 backpacking trip when Amie had the opportunity to get to know the Bopha women and subsequently found out about some of them having involvement with intergenerational prostitution. The last four years have been spent doing research and taking trips to India to further lay ground-work in the community as a learner and friend. It is our belief that to have a sustainable project, the project has to be under the ownership and the active vision of the people involved. Shanti seeks to promote the economic and social well-being of marginalized women and children; not only to break free the chains of poverty and prostitution, but to encourage empowerment. 

Our Rewards

Bamboo Flatware

 

Up-cycled Saree Bedding/Sleep Sacks

Your help gives us the seed money we need to run this income generation project and make it sustainable! All of your donations go to the project on the ground in India! We are looking forward to seeing the lives of these families changed for the better. We truly appreciate your help in authenticating this vision we've been laying the groundwork for. Your support allows us to foster the visions of the Bopha people. 

If you can't donate, that's completely okay. We really appreciate you taking the time to read this and if you could contribute your VOICE that would be HUGE. Use the "share" button below to let others know. "All I have to offer is my singing and distilled existence." -W. Soyinka 

Risks and Challenges

One potential obstacle we can foresee has to do with the demographic involved: It is a tricky thing to set up clear vocational perimeters and quality control amongst a demographic that has never had these. With this said, we allowed ourselves ample margins to complete the rewards we have offered here, knowing that things in India always take much more time than they do in the states.

All of our work thus far has been volunteer based. We have paid our own flights, living stipends and American bills. All funds raised have gone directly to the project. This is something we are proud of, but have also come to realize as not the most sustainable thing in the world. We would be able to do far more with a team that doesn't have to scrape up side jobs to pay bills. So we are starting here on Kickstarter asking for help so that we have clout to further ask for funding from foundations and other high-impact investors.

Thanks for being the change.

*This video was created for a Kickstarter campaign, but since we are a 501c3, we Kickstarter didn't allow us to publish this campaign through them. We also originally had a higher goal of raising 10,000 (as stated in the video). We changed this seed goal to a 3,000 USD after getting a few more donations and realizing that we didn't need to ask for so much from our friends and families. With this said, it still means THE WORLD to us to have the support of those we love. Anything you can contribute would mean so much to us. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts, Amie for The Shanti Project
