story:
Our campaign has ended, but you can pre-order your own Pi-Top at www.Pi-Top.com or choose the Indiegogo InDemand option and get a first batch 
Pi-Top!

We have now completed the final case design, below is a video of all the prototypes leading to our final injection moulded design!

WHAT IS PI-TOP?

"Voila! A little open source computer for you and yours"  - TechCrunch

"The days of home brew, DIY computer making are back, but in mutated form"- Vice: Motherboard

"We just came across Pi-Top & fell in love." - RS Components

Pi-Top provides a platform to expand your knowledge in hardware creation. The kit takes you through each of its components and their functionality, so that you can use Pi-Top as a tool for your own projects in the future.

Pi-Top focuses on teaching people how to create real hardware. Online and integrated lesson plans teach you how to understand electronics, create Printed Circuit Boards, and 3D print objects.

Pi-Top comes with an injection moulded case so you can build Pi-Top on day one. Every kit also comes with 3D printing files so you can print your own Pi-Top case!  

As a thank you to our eariest backers, "Day One" Pi-Top full kit contributors, will receive an extra FREE lazer cut acrylic slice with a unique design lazer etched into the acrylic! Only available to those backing us on 14th October.

AS SEEN IN

Eben Upton, founder of Raspberry Pi, talks with John Biggs at TechCrunch Disrupt Europe 2014 about Pi-Top


WHO IS IT FOR?

The Pi-Top kit is built with beginners in mind. Our goal is to make hardware as accessible as software is now, and a big part of that is making it beginner friendly. 

No soldering is required to build Pi-Top and a beginner should expect to be able to complete the kit in an evening. 

We want you to be able to create your own products and ideas. The Pi-Top kit is the start of a journey that will see you gaining the skills to build and code your own hardware.

A gamified learning experience will take you to a stage where you are designing your own components and products. You will be able to work together on projects, contribute and help each other through the lesson plans and share your work with others.


WHAT CAN I DO WITH PI-TOP?

Pi-Top is here to give you the platform to learn how to create hardware. With Pi-Top you will gain the skills to make your ideas come to life.

MAKE REAL HARDWARE

Pi-Top focuses on teaching you the key skills to start making real hardware products. By combining Printed Circuit Board (PCB) design and 3D Printing we give you the knowledge to create any hardware product you want to make – by giving you the skills to create you are only limited by your imagination!

By using Pi-Top you will learn to make and control home automation devices, robots, and consumer electronics. We focus on teaching you transferable skills so that you can start making fast. We have trialled our learning process by traveling and teaching hardware innovation lessons to students around the UK.

We recently taught a group of students at King Edwards school Birmingham, UK how to create an LED circuit – code it with the PI-Top; and then applying those core skills the students were able to control a Raspberry Pi Robot. By learning in this way, you can begin to create basic hardware after the first Pi-Top lesson.


WHAT’S IN THE KIT? 

1)  Injection molded case

2)  3D printer STL files compatible for most print bed sizes (5" x 5" bed size and up)

3)  PCBs - Power Management, HDMI to LVDS Bridge and Keyboard & Trackpad Controller.

4)  Electronics breadboard

5)  Battery

6)  Keyboard

7)  Trackpad

8)  13.3”HD LCD Screen

9)  Wifi adapter

9)  Acrylic slice

10)  Wiring

11)  DC wall plug

12)  Build instructions

13)  Online & integrated lesson plans

HATS!

We love that Raspberry Pi has released the HAT specification, it opens up a huge range of added functionality. 

HATs are small addon boards you attach to the top of the Raspberry Pi. They are designed to give the Pi extra functionality.

Pi-Top is built with using HATs in mind. Space has been built in so HATs can be programmed and used anywhere with Pi-Top. Pi-Top will be released with three world first HATs - all adding a huge layer of functionality.

1) Pi-Top LCD Hat


One of the problems Pi-Top solves is that Raspberry Pi users traditionally have to settle for small screen sizes if they want a mobile Pi. Our solution in Pi-Top was to create an HDMI to LVDS bridge PCB. We have used these designs to create an LCD HAT that will allow the Raspberry Pi Model B+ to connect to any LCD screen that has a single channel LVDS interface (which is usually anything less than 1400x1050 resolution). The LCD HAT makes it easy to make displays and a range of mobile devices.

2) Robot HAT 


We set out to create the easiest, most accessible, compact and functional Raspberry Pi Robot in the world. The Robot HAT sits on top of the Raspberry Pi inside your Pi-Top. You code it using Python and the Pi-Top lesson plans. Then simply remove the Raspberry Pi from Pi-Top, clip on a 3D printed chassis and your robot is ready to go!

In terms of functionality, the robot HAT gives you access to motor and servo drivers, digital-to-analogue converters, analog-to-digital converters, LEDs, IR proximity sensors and more. Due to how the HAT has been designed to clip into the 3D printed chassis, you will have access to other GPIOs so that you can customise the chassis to include even more sensors! The HAT also takes care of safely charging a lipo battery which keeps the Raspberry Pi running when you unclip it from Pi-Top.

3) Home Automation HAT


We have packed this HAT with loads of sensors so that you can retrieve information from the environment surrounding your Raspberry Pi, including pressure, humidity, temperature, touch, IR proximity and sound. The HAT also gives you access to several outputs, so that you can use the data you have collected to control the environment, including motor drives, a relay switch, a 7 segment digital readout and a buzzer. With this HAT you will be able to practice and learn how to use data collected by sensors to create automated devices. Learn to make hundreds of different products from this one HAT!

PI-TOP CUSTOMIZATION 

Pi-Top is fully customisable! 3D print your own case on any 5" x 5" print bed, design and lazer cut custom Acrylic Slice's for your Pi-Top. Let your imagination run wild and make something completely unique to you!

WHY PI-TOP?

We think Pi-Top is a great platform to learn how to create hardware. Here's what others have said about Pi-Top. 

Mustafa is is the Manager of iMakr Store London, UK.

Rory is a Durham graduate with a degree in Electrical Engineering.

Aman attended the Pi-Top Hardware Lesson, part of the 225 Academy  learning experience.

START LEARNING

The Pi-Top Lesson plans will guide you through the complex world of hardware. We make 3D printing, printed circuit board design and building accessible. Pi-Top provides a clear pathway to progress and increase your abilities to create.

We have traveled the UK getting feedback from hundreds of students, educators and makers to bring Pi-Top to where it is today. We have redesigned Pi-Top based on hundreds of user comments from all across the maker community and we think it’s an amazing way to start learning about hardware.

All of our lesson plans will be available for free online. Pi-Top is just the start, we will be updating and creating gamified lesson plans as new technologies emerge and existing tech changes. With these lessons you will be able to start as a complete beginner and work towards advanced projects, working with others and earning experience/ rewards along the way. We want people to learn how to make anything and have fun doing it.

ANY CLASS, ANY ROOM, ANYWHERE

Pi-Top is mobile! With 6 – 8 hours battery life, a built in Keyboard trackpad and 13.3” screen, Pi-Top makes learning with the Raspberry Pi easier than ever. No need for HDMI monitors, USB keyboards & mice. Pi-Top opens the power of learning with Raspberry Pi to any class, any room, anywhere you want!


OUR STORY

Ryan and I met just over 8 months ago and this is what has happened so far:

With the help of David Robinson we create the first prototype rendersWe create the first Pi-Top Prototypes. They're a little rough around the edges but we love them!Creating the final PCB designsWe test our first prototype PCBs, and start creating the 3D print case designWe start to teach Hardware Innovation lessons with the first 3D printed Pi-Top and receive feedback on how to improve the design.We talked to hundreds of students and parents to see how we could improve Pi-Top as a makers toolWe visit Makerspaces to get feedback on the Pi-Top. After receiving lots of feedback, we complete the final Pi-Top prototype ready for productionPreparing for our Indiegogo launch!


THE TEAM

Jesse Lozano

Co-Founder - Software Developer

"I studied Law at Kings College University, and in my spare time used free learning tools to become a software developer. This is why affordable computing is at the heart of the Pi-Top kit. We really want to provide value for money, that's why the Pi-Top kit lessons and all major software updates will be free."

Ryan Dunwoody

Co-Founder - Hardware/Software Developer

"I studied Engineering at Oxford University. Whilst there I became convinced Raspberry Pi could be used as a tool to accelerate practical hardware skills, even from a beginner level. We have built Pi-Top to be a practical learning tool. Pi-Top helps teach you the skills to build anything."

David Robinson

Product Design & Animation 

"When Ryan & Jesse explained their plans for Pi-Top, I wanted to help make it a reality. We have designed a form fitting case that is practical to use every day. The Pi-Top has been an exciting product to develop, one that has huge potential to continue developing into the future."

Agata Lis

Video Production

"I have been following the development of this project from early stages and am joining it now to co-ordinate and deliver video content. Pi-Top helps people learn key skills at an affordable cost, something I was happy to be involved in. I am excited to use my expertise to help this product launch."

Reuben Nanda

Video Production

"I am a trained designer with focus on filmmaking and animation. I have helped to deliver the video content and am thrilled to be a part of this project. The Pi-Top laptop is a product that will change the accessibility to high level computing skills, something I am very excited to be a part of."

OUR VISION

We want to see a world of makers creating real hardware products – using new technologies like 3D printing to make amazing products. Pi-Top.com has been visited by people from over 130 different countries – we have come to Indiegogo for its huge reach to create a globally connected makers platform.

We think hardware is amazing, but realise that there are complex barriers to overcome before you can really start creating. With Pi-Top we have worked to simplify how you learn about these complex areas. Pi-Top clearly sets out and takes you through every technical hurdle so anyone can start creating.

WE NEED YOUR HELP

We have spent the last 8 months creating, testing and remaking Pi-Top with:

-  Hundreds of 13 –18 year old students

-  Educators

-  Makers & Makerspaces

-  Complete beginners

-  Advanced users

The prototype works and has been used by hundreds of people to learn how to create hardware. We are confident in our technology and have worked hard to organise our supply chain.

But we need your help to make it happen!

In order to keep the Pi-Top as affordable as possible, we need $80,000 to create the first 250 units. At this volume we are able to affordably produce and fulfil Pi-Top to you. With your help we can bring hardware to everyone, making it more accessible, fun and affordable!

PRODUCTION TIMELINE

PURCHASING & SHIPPING


Where do you ship to?

We use major courier companies and we will ship to anywhere that they deliver.

Is shipping included? 

Shipping is $35 anywhere in Europe. USA & Canada shipping is $45. Other countries $55

(Purchasers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries) Countries within the EU VAT is included in the purchase price.

Colours
The injection moulded Pi-Top case will be available in multiple colours voted on by  all Pi-Top full kit backers! The number of backers will affect how many colours we can produce, more backers = more colours!

RISKS & CHALENGES

Before coming to Indiegogo we wanted to ensure that Pi-Top could become a reality. We started over 8 months ago developing Pi-Top. We have been through over a dozen prototype iterations, and gotten feedback from hundreds of people to bring you this final design.

We have sourced every component needed for Pi-Top from suppliers across the world to create the 3D printed prototypes we have today. After thorough testing and relationship building with our suppliers, Pi-Top is now ready to be released on a larger scale.

We are confident our 7 month production timeline is achievable. Since the start of Pi-Top we have updated regularly on our Facebook page and will continue to keep everyone informed of our progress in the months following the campaign. Manufacturing has complexities and hurdles to overcome and we will keep you informed every step of the way.


FOLLOW US ON FB & TWITTER

START LEARNING
The Pi-Top Lesson plans will guide you through the complex world of hardware. We make 3D printing, printed circuit board design and building accessible. Pi-Top provides a clear pathway to progress and increase your abilities to create.


We have traveled the UK getting feedback from hundreds of students, educators and makers to bring Pi-Top to where it is today. We have redesigned Pi-Top based on hundreds of user comments from all across the maker community and we think it’s an amazing way to start learning about hardware.


All of our lesson plans will be available for free online. Pi-Top is just the start, we will be updating and creating gamified lesson plans as new technologies emerge and existing tech changes. With these lessons you will be able to start as a complete beginner and work towards advanced projects, working with others and earning experience/ rewards along the way. We want people to learn how to make anything and have fun doing it.
ANY CLASS, ANY ROOM, ANYWHERE


Pi-Top is mobile! With 6 – 8 hours battery life, a built in Keyboard trackpad and 13.3” screen, Pi-Top makes learning with the Raspberry Pi easier than ever. No need for HDMI monitors, USB keyboards & mice. Pi-Top opens the power of learning with Raspberry Pi to any class, any room, anywhere you want!


OUR STORY
Ryan and I met just over 8 months ago and this is what has happened so far:

With the help of David Robinson we create the first prototype rendersWe create the first Pi-Top Prototypes. They're a little rough around the edges but we love them!Creating the final PCB designsWe test our first prototype PCBs, and start creating the 3D print case designWe start to teach Hardware Innovation lessons with the first 3D printed Pi-Top and receive feedback on how to improve the design.We talked to hundreds of students and parents to see how we could improve Pi-Top as a makers toolWe visit Makerspaces to get feedback on the Pi-Top. After receiving lots of feedback, we complete the final Pi-Top prototype ready for productionPreparing for our Indiegogo launch!


THE TEAM



Jesse Lozano
Co-Founder - Software Developer
"I studied Law at Kings College University, and in my spare time used free learning tools to become a software developer. This is why affordable computing is at the heart of the Pi-Top kit. We really want to provide value for money, that's why the Pi-Top kit lessons and all major software updates will be free."




Ryan Dunwoody
Co-Founder - Hardware/Software Developer
"I studied Engineering at Oxford University. Whilst there I became convinced Raspberry Pi could be used as a tool to accelerate practical hardware skills, even from a beginner level. We have built Pi-Top to be a practical learning tool. Pi-Top helps teach you the skills to build anything."




David Robinson
Product Design & Animation 
"When Ryan & Jesse explained their plans for Pi-Top, I wanted to help make it a reality. We have designed a form fitting case that is practical to use every day. The Pi-Top has been an exciting product to develop, one that has huge potential to continue developing into the future."




Agata LisVideo Production
"I have been following the development of this project from early stages and am joining it now to co-ordinate and deliver video content. Pi-Top helps people learn key skills at an affordable cost, something I was happy to be involved in. I am excited to use my expertise to help this product launch."




Reuben NandaVideo Production
"I am a trained designer with focus on filmmaking and animation. I have helped to deliver the video content and am thrilled to be a part of this project. The Pi-Top laptop is a product that will change the accessibility to high level computing skills, something I am very excited to be a part of."
OUR VISION
We want to see a world of makers creating real hardware products – using new technologies like 3D printing to make amazing products. Pi-Top.com has been visited by people from over 130 different countries – we have come to Indiegogo for its huge reach to create a globally connected makers platform.
We think hardware is amazing, but realise that there are complex barriers to overcome before you can really start creating. With Pi-Top we have worked to simplify how you learn about these complex areas. Pi-Top clearly sets out and takes you through every technical hurdle so anyone can start creating.



WE NEED YOUR HELP
We have spent the last 8 months creating, testing and remaking Pi-Top with:
-  Hundreds of 13 –18 year old students
-  Educators
-  Makers & Makerspaces
-  Complete beginners
-  Advanced users
The prototype works and has been used by hundreds of people to learn how to create hardware. We are confident in our technology and have worked hard to organise our supply chain.
But we need your help to make it happen!
In order to keep the Pi-Top as affordable as possible, we need $80,000 to create the first 250 units. At this volume we are able to affordably produce and fulfil Pi-Top to you. With your help we can bring hardware to everyone, making it more accessible, fun and affordable!
PRODUCTION TIMELINE




PURCHASING & SHIPPING



Where do you ship to?
We use major courier companies and we will ship to anywhere that they deliver.
Is shipping included? 
Shipping is $35 anywhere in Europe. USA & Canada shipping is $45. Other countries $55
(Purchasers are responsible for any VAT or customs duties levied by their own countries) Countries within the EU VAT is included in the purchase price.
ColoursThe injection moulded Pi-Top case will be available in multiple colours voted on by  all Pi-Top full kit backers! The number of backers will affect how many colours we can produce, more backers = more colours!
RISKS & CHALENGES
Before coming to Indiegogo we wanted to ensure that Pi-Top could become a reality. We started over 8 months ago developing Pi-Top. We have been through over a dozen prototype iterations, and gotten feedback from hundreds of people to bring you this final design.
We have sourced every component needed for Pi-Top from suppliers across the world to create the 3D printed prototypes we have today. After thorough testing and relationship building with our suppliers, Pi-Top is now ready to be released on a larger scale.
We are confident our 7 month production timeline is achievable. Since the start of Pi-Top we have updated regularly on our Facebook page and will continue to keep everyone informed of our progress in the months following the campaign. Manufacturing has complexities and hurdles to overcome and we will keep you informed every step of the way.
FOLLOW US ON FB & TWITTER

story:
MAKE YOUR DOLLAR MAGIC!

We are the Boys & Girls Club of Santa Cruz teens and we are SO EXCITED that you found our campaign! 

The Downtown Santa Cruz Boys & Girls Club is an extraordinary place. It is made up of exceptional young people who have lived an arsenal of stories to become the kids we love and work alongside every day. That is especially true of our teen program. 

The teen program is made up of exceptional young people. People who are loving, kind, strong and intelligent. 

They are also the people who are often forgotten, underrated, undervalued and discounted. 

That's not the case, however, at The Boys & Girls Club. 

We see these teens for the exceptional people that they really are. We hold them to the standards of what we know they have inside of them. We hold them to the standards of leaders, innovators and pillars of the community. Time and time again, they prove us right.

While our teens come from all different walks of life, the most common theme is that they all make the choice to show up. And sometimes, that's the hardest decision for someone to make. We have teens who are survivors of gang violence, domestic abuse, of parental substance abuse, and yet they still find the strength in themselves to make the choice to show up every day and work to actively make a difference not only in their lives but the lives of others. 

Many of our kids while they are kind, loving people have been forced to grow up far too fast. Many of them have forgotten what it's like to be lost in innocence and to thrive in the magic that life can hold. 

That's where you come in.

By donating here, you will make your dollar magic! By donating any of the amounts listed in the "Perks" section, not only will you be donating to help our teens spread joy and kindness through the community but you will also be helping to bring a little magic back into their lives.  One donation will be working double time to spread the "Magic of Kindness" both to our teens and to the community at large! 

Our teens have expressed a deep desire to go to Disneyland. Many of them have never gone, and even more of them would not be able to afford a trip if it wasn't for a campaign like this. If you choose to donate, your money will be going toward the fund to get the teens who meet the requirements (below) to Disneyland. Your donation will be associated with an act of kindness that thee teens will do throughout the community (the specific acts can be found in the "Perks" section).

Thank you so much for taking the time out of your day to read this. And even if you do not have the means to donate, it would mean the world to the teens (and to the people the teens acts of kindness will benefit) if you passed along the link to this campaign. 

These teens truly are wonderful people and it is the absolute pleasure of the Boys & Girls Club staff to be able to witness the growth these young people make every day. As a supportive community, we can work together to show these kids that when you put Goodness out into the world, it comes back around to you. 

Thank you so much for your help now let's work together to #Makeyourdollarmagic


REQUIREMENTS FOR THE TEENS TO QUALIFY FOR THE TRIP: 

-2.5+ GPA

-Good standing with ALL club staff

-No incident reports at the club

-No referals from school

-Active participation in Boys & Girls Club programming 

-Attendance at the club 2+ days a week

-Participation in 60+ "Make Your Dollar Magic" activities

-Must be 12+ at the time of the trip


(*professional photos for the campaign courtesy of the amazing people at ewattsphotography. Their breathtaking work can be found here*)

story:
Short Summary

Irvine Muzuva aged 20 and  I am a Kufunda Village Youth Alumni. I have been staying at Kufunda Village (www.kufunda.org) for a year now. I started staying there after the Youth leadership program that i attended in 2012. Kufunda Village started supporting me when i was still at school by providing my school fees. I wrote my exams in 2010 but i did not manage to get my results because i couldn't afford to pay the exam fee. I stayed for the whole year doing nothing at home, even the hope of that i can do something was dying. I was invited to the youth leadership program and it has transformed my whole life. It made me to be able to define myself and know what i want with clear intentions. At Kufunda i am involved in different projects but most strongly in the art of hosting, the communiversity and I am taking the lead in our recycling and upcyling project. I have stepped into hosting early this year and my passions have strongly grown towards having the conversation with other young people of what we haven't been talking about. Bringing young people together to engage around what matters most to each of us.

  • What Is YIP

I see YIP as a place of finding balance and strength for my leadership journey. A place to get inspired and motivated by different young people from different from countries with different background and culture. It is like a womb where i am being shaped for my being and becoming. A place where i will learn how to define myself clearly and how to approach the world around me....

For more progress of my YIP Journey Please Read More Posts Here 

Thank You

On The Beginning of This Journey last year in August  I asked for the preparation support. The picture below shows. Thank you so much making this experience possible for me.



What I Need...

I have been granted  with the support of  SEK 84 487 ( $ 12896) from different means. This time i am asking for the support to finish funding my YIP year in the amount of SEK 25 000 (  $ 3816). My YIP is finishing on 30 June this year. All the money from this campaign will go towards the covering the last costs and expenses. 

 *Below is the Budget* of My whole year financial status. It gives the whole picture of what i already got and what i do still need.


Irvine’s Budget for YIP 2013 - 2014

Costs

YIP participation Fee

SEK 85 000

Food Weekends

SEK 2 000

Food Breaks

SEK 1 000

Pocket Money

SEK 3 000

Flight tickets

SEK 11 396

Visa fee

SEK 584

Travel airport - Järna

SEK 300

Preparation cost

SEK 1 944

Health Insurance

SEK 4 263

TOTAL

SEK 109 487

Granted means

First donation YIP Diversity Fund autumn 2013

SEK 17 476

Indiegogo Crowdfunding Campaign

SEK 13 944

Kufunda donation

SEK 4 927

Gift from Elida

SEK 2 500

Donation from Föreningen Sofia

SEK 3 000

Donation from Olga & Linda

SEK 1 748

Second donation YIP Diversity Fund spring 2014

SEK 40 892

TOTAL

SEK 84 487

Fundraising still taking place

Crowdfunding Campaign – Round 2   

1st of May – 1st of June 2014

SEK 25 000

TOTAL

SEK 25 000


The Impact

As I have stated above, your support will help me to fully cover the costs and expenses towards my YIP year. This year was not Just a year, it was a transformation and growing journey. I have been  able to step up shinning so brightly while  strengthening my leadership. New paths and skills has been discovered. This experience at YIP is a gift i am taking back with me to Zimbabwe and I am going to the learning and everything i got to inspire other young people. I have been doing leadership work before coming to YIP but only thing was missing, now i feel  i am confident enough to dive into the deep at least when taking about implementing and engaging in leadership action. Help me finish carry this work , dream and inspiration home with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always support in any way possible. Any support is welcome. Please share the word and let the whole support too .

story:
Short Summary

(I'm massaging that cat)

Friends, family, and lovers (future, present and past): As many of you know, I am enrolled to begin massage school in the fall of 2014 at Spectrum School of Massage in Lake Stevens. I will continue to work full time but even so, I am finding that school is financially hard to manage with no parental support (though my mom would sell her kidneys for me if she could). Of course, I can (and will) take out a loans, but thought I would take this opportunity to ask for contributions so that I may attend and graduate school with less financial burden.

What I Need & What You Get

Tuition is $12,000, plus the cost of books and supplies. I have been able to save up $2000 to put towards tuition, but would be happy and incredibly grateful to receive any amount to go towards the remainder.

*** IF YOU don't have any money to offer but would like to offer a service as a "perk", that would be cool too!

    The Impact

    I want to be able to give the healing gift of touch to others while also having the joy and freedom to do something I love.

    In other words, please let me give you massages and quit living this wretched office life.

story:
*Support Charity*  

*4 Day Polar Circle Hike + Climbing Swedens Highest Mountain*  

*ALL WHILST USING SCHOOLBAGS*


Two friends, walking 4 days in the Swedish Polar Circle, whilst using only school bags for their equipment. We do this because we believe it is for a good cause!


*TAX REFUNDABLE*

just tick the  box next to your email address to get a receipt


.:deutsche version weiter unten:.


.: Follow our trip on FACEBOOK :.




WHY would we go to all this trouble?

All around the world there are children living in remote locations who daily, endure hours of walking just to get to their nearest school. We want to help change this by supporting Student 4 Charity, a Swedish student organisation helping children worldwide to get a better outlook on life.  Why? Because we believe everyone should have the chance to easily access education. 

After travelling to the Philippines last year I saw real poverty for the first time. It was here that I visited a slum in Cebu City, and made friends with a 9 year old boy, Rafael. He explained to us that he worked from morning until night, gardening for the rich so he could earn just $2 a day. To my surprise he then happily spent that money on school supplies. This made me realise: Education is not granted!

I felt it was about time I tried to help bring about a change here. Seeing families, living with more than 14 people in a small wooden shelter, trying to make a living each day, and taking care of their elders, made me realise that they could not escape from the cycle without help from the outside. This is particularly bad in the Philippines, but also a huge problem world-wide.

Student 4 Charity is a local organisation in Lund, Sweden, that was started four years ago. The organisation is run by students and the purpose is to make education more accessible in third world countries. They have already built a school in Kenya in 2012 and now have their aim on Miacao, Colombia. Miacao is a remote village in northern Colombia where the children have no access to any education and in August this year, Students for Charity is going to change that. With the support of a large charity organisation called Ankarstiftelsen that will help with the administration and running of the school after, the members of Students 4 Charity will travel to Miacao and build the school. We want to help them to make that happen!

And do you know what the best thing is? Students 4 Charity don't need any administration fee or anything. 100% of what they're raising goes straight into to project and the kids down there in Columbia.


ALRIGHT, I CAN AFFORD TO CHUCK IN A FEW BUCKS!




WHAT do we want to do to change that?

 As Joseph and I are still students, trying to finish our degrees at the moment, we need to give something else other than money and we are more than happy to do so. Our plan is to draw attention towards these issues through this crazy idea and get as many supporters on board as we can. Everyone can help these children - especially you!

 1800km northwards of Malmo, we will start the longest trip to school Sweden has ever seen! Four entire days of living in the wild, climbing Sweden's highest mountain and hike endless tracks whilst using only schoolbags and only what we can put inside these. All of this only to raise attention and get pictures around the globe that make people aware of this issue! That's the deal!


Man that's awesome, I'd love to support you!



WHAT'S the big deal I hear you say?  

Usually for a trip such as this you would carry a large amount of equipment in a backpack that can hold anything up to 90litres. By using just a school bag we are limiting ourselves to around only 12litres of storage dramatically reducing the amount of equipment we can carry. Over a four-day hike it will take careful planning to carry only what we need to survive. We will have to forget most modern day luxuries that hikers are now used too.



WHERE do we want to do that?  

The aim is the Kebnekaise, Sweden's highest mountain massif which rises 2106m (6909ft) from the frozen Nordic ground. Being situated nearly 150km north of the border to the polar circle, the Kebnekaise consists of two summits offering one of northern Europe’s most magnificent views of Sweden. It is a dangerous peak often shrouded with bad weather and poor visability.

Here, where the night lasts up to 19 hours during winter, and the snow of the arctic never really melts, people have made surviving possible through several huts along the way in case the weather changes too quickly.


Serious, I always got a couple of bucks for that stuff!



CAN we have some more details?

  • Day 1   Arriving in Kiruna, taking the Bus Nikkaluokta, camping somwhere in the wilderness 
  • Day 2   Getting up early, putting on the equipment and leaving for the 26km roundtrip to the summit and back
  • Day 3   Continuing hiking in the area
  • Day 4   Getting back to Kiruna and flying out to Stockholm



WHAT experience do you got?

Joseph as well as myself (Lucas) have been travelling/backpacking/hiking in many areas around the world to be confident enough to bring this attempt to success.

While I specifically have experience in climbing/mountaineering, Joseph is the Swedish mastermind behind all that. As a local he will make things easy, being used to the Swedish wilderness and - of course - the people.



HOW will you use the money raised?  

As we are trying to get as much money for a good cause together as we possibly can - of course, we will only deduct the travel expenses up to Kiruna, from where our journey starts. To be honest, as we both are still students and funding our lifes with part time jobs on little hours, that's the only way to do it. I hope you will understand this.

In case there is not enough for us being collected, we will donate the whole amount received by Students 4 Charity.



DON'T have anything on you just now? - There are many ways to help!  

Money isn’t the only support we need!

Share Share Share !! Isn't that the power these days anyway? Connect us to organisations, companies, small business or private sponsors that want to take part in it! Help us to create attention to the issue its self as well as our project No matter what becomes of this, THANK YOU for reading, donating or just thinking about two lads on a mountain in the polar circle with schoolbags! 

Much love.


Definitely gonna fund that!


.: Follow our trip on FACEBOOK :.




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


Deutsche Version


*Unterstütze Charity*  

*4-tägige Wanderung im Polarkreis + Besteigung des höchsten Berges von Schweden*  

*ALL DAS MIT SCHULTORNISTERN*


Zwei Freunde, 4 Tage Wegstrecke im schwedischen Polarkreis und das alles nur mit Schultornistern! Wir machen das, weil wir daran glauben dass es einem guten Zweck dient!


*VON DER STEUER ABSETZBAR*

Einfach einen klick auf den Kasten neben deiner Emailadresse


.: Folge unserem Trip auf FACEBOOK :.


WARUM würde man sowas machen wollen?

Auf der ganzen Welt gibt es Kinder, die dadurch, dass sie in entlegenen Regionen wohnen, täglich Stunden nur für den Schulweg auf sich nehmen müssen. Wir wollen helfen das zu ändern, indem wir Spenden für die schwedische Organisation Students 4 Charity sammeln, die weltweit Kindern dabei hilft, einen besseres Leben haben zu können. Warum? Weil wir glauben, dass ein jeder das Recht auf Bildung besitzt!

Während ich letztes Jahr die Philippinen bereiste, habe ich zum ersten Mal in meinem Leben echte Armut erlebt. Als wir ein Slum in Cebu City besuchten, lernte ich den 9-jährigen Rafael kennen, der sich damit brüstete den ganzen Tag bei reicheren Leuten im Garten arbeiten zu dürfen. Mit den $2, die er dabei verdiente, war er glücklich Hefte und Stifte für die Schule kaufen zu können um irgendwann auchmal da zu wohnen, wo die Reichen wohnen dürften. Mit den Eindrücken, die ich bereits im Hinterkopf hatte und dem dumpfen Gefühl, dass auch der Tag einmal käme an dem Rafaels Träume der Realität begegneten, realisierte ich, dass nachhaltige Bildung einfach nicht selbstverständlich ist.

Ich hatte das Gefühl Rafael helfen zu wollen, aber fühlte mich ohnmächtig. Auch im weiteren Verlauf meiner Reise zu sehen, wie viele Menschen auf den Philippinen teils mit einem Dutzend Angehörigen in kleinen, hölzernen Verschlägen leben und wie sehr sich ihr Leben nur um das Verdienen des täglichen Brotes dreht, brachte mich zu der Einsicht, dass jenen kein Entkommen aus diesem Teufelskreis ermöglicht wird, wenn man nicht von außen etwas tut. Dies ist nicht nur auf den Philippinen ein ernst zu nehmendes Problem

Students 4 Charity ist dabei eine in Lund, Schweden, ansässige Organisation, die ihre Arbeit vor vier Jahren aufgenommen hat. Sie wird von Studenten betrieben und hat das Ziel, Bildung in dritte Welt Ländern besser erreichbar und verfügbar zu machen. Ein erster Erfolg war dabei die Errichtung einer Schule in Kenya, 2012, welches als Beispiel für das diesjährige Projekt in Miacao, Kolumbien, dient. Miacao ist ein abgelegenes Dorf in Nord-Kolumbien wo Kinder bisher keinerlei Zugang zu Bildung besitzen. Im August diesen Jahres will Students 4 Charity dies ändern! Unter er Federführung von der schwedischen Organisation Ankarstiftelsen, die die Schule nach Errichtung betreiben wird, werden die Mitglieder von Students 4 Charity im August selber nach Kolumbien fahren, um dort der Gemeine Miacao eine Schule zu errichten.

Wir wollen ihnen dabei helfen und Geld für dieses einzigartige Projekt sammeln! 



WAS wollt ihr machen um das zu ändern?

Da Joseph und ich derzeit noch Studenten sind, wollen wir etwas Anderes als Geld geben! Unser Plan ist es, Aufmerksamkeit zu erzeugen, die wir auf diese Probleme lenken wollen und am besten macht man das mit einer verrückten Idee, oder?

1800km nördlich von Malmø gehts dann auf den längsten Schulweg, den Schweden wahrscheinlich jeh gesehen hat! Vier ganze Tage in der arktischen Wildnis Laplands zu leben, Schwedens höchsten Berg zu besteigen und endlose Pfade zu erlaufen, während wir nur das mitnehmen, was wir in üblichen Grundschultornistern verpackt bekommen. Klingt das nach etwas Verrücktem?


Klingt super, ein paar Euro habe ich dafür über!


"WAS ist schon dabei?"  höre ich dich sagen?

Normalerweise braucht man für so einen Trip einen großen professionellen Rucksack, der viel Stauraum von bis zu 90 Litern garantiert. Da wir Schultornister benutzen, limitieren wir uns selber zu ungefähr 12 Litern, was uns dazu verpflichtet sehr vorsichtig und durchdacht diesen Trip zu planen. Vieles, was Wanderer über die letzten Jahre schätzen gelernt haben, wird uns fehlen. Aber wer braucht schon Luxus?



WO genau wollt ihr das denn machen?  

Das Ziel ist der Kebnekaise, Schwedens höchstes Bergmassiv, das 2106 Meter aus dem arktischen Boden ragt. Der beinahe 150km nördlich des Polarkreises liegende Berg ist die letzte große Erhebung des europäischen Festlandes und bietet bei gutem Wetter eine Aussicht auf fast 10% Nordschwedens. Seine zwei Gipfel, von denen der südlichere in einen Gletscher gehüllt ist, werden oft von Wetterumschwüngen und schlechter Sicht heimgesucht.

Hier, wo die Nacht  im Winter bis zu 19 Stunden dauern kann und der arktische Schnee nie wirklich wegschmilzt haben Menschen mehrere Verschläge entlang der Wegstrecke gebaut, die wir auch nutzen werden.



GIBT es mehr Details?

  • Tag 1   Ankunft in Kiruna, Bus nach Nikkaluokta, Camping in der Wildnis am Fuße des Berges
  • Tag 2   Früh aufstehen und auf zum 26km Rundtrip zum Gipfel und zurück
  • Tag 3   Weiter Wandern im Gebiet um den Kebnekaise
  • Tag 4   Zurück nach Kiruna und Abreise nach Stockholm


Alles klar, ich bin an Bord, ein paar Euro habt ihr hier!


WELCHE Erfahrung habt ihr?

Joseph und ich sind schon in vielen Regionen der Erde gewandert/geklettert/gebackpacked um zu wissen was da auf uns zukommt. 90km in vier Tagen ist einiges, aber definitv schaffbar!



WIE werdet ihr das gesammelte Geld verwenden?  

Da wir versuchen so viel Geld wie nur möglich für Students 4 Charity zu sammeln, werden wir nur die Summe subtrahieren die wir brauchen um nach Kiruna zu kommen, von wo der Trip startet. 

Falls wir nicht genug für die Anreise zusammen bekommen, werden wir Alles an Students 4 Charity spenden!



DU hast gerade nichts aber willst helfen? - Gerne!  

Es ist nicht nur Geld, das einen Unterschied macht, sondern lese hier, wie du auch anders helfen kannst:

Teilen Teilen Teilen !! Ist das nicht das so oder so die Macht heutzutage?

Empfehle uns Firmen, kleinen Geschäften, Privatleuten, die uns sponsorn wollen!

Hilf uns Aufmerksamkeit auf dieses Problem zu ziehen und vielen Leuten davon zu erzählen! 


Vielen Dank :-)


Das klingt richtig geil, ich will euch unterstützen!


.: Folge unserem Trip auf FACEBOOK :.
story_txt:
*Support Charity*  *4 Day Polar Circle Hike + Climbing Swedens Highest Mountain*  *ALL WHILST USING SCHOOLBAGS*Two friends, walking 4 days in the Swedish Polar Circle, whilst using only school bags for their equipment. We do this because we believe it is for a good cause!*TAX REFUNDABLE*just tick the  box next to your email address to get a receipt.:deutsche version weiter unten:..: Follow our trip on FACEBOOK :.WHY would we go to all this trouble?All around the world there are children living in remote locations who daily, endure hours of walking just to get to their nearest school. We want to help change this by supporting Student 4 Charity, a Swedish student organisation helping children worldwide to get a better outlook on life.  Why? Because we believe everyone should have the chance to easily access education. After travelling to the Philippines last year I saw real poverty for the first time. It was here that I visited a slum in Cebu City, and made friends with a 9 year old boy, Rafael. He explained to us that he worked from morning until night, gardening for the rich so he could earn just $2 a day. To my surprise he then happily spent that money on school supplies. This made me realise: Education is not granted!I felt it was about time I tried to help bring about a change here. Seeing families, living with more than 14 people in a small wooden shelter, trying to make a living each day, and taking care of their elders, made me realise that they could not escape from the cycle without help from the outside. This is particularly bad in the Philippines, but also a huge problem world-wide.Student 4 Charity is a local organisation in Lund, Sweden, that was started four years ago. The organisation is run by students and the purpose is to make education more accessible in third world countries. They have already built a school in Kenya in 2012 and now have their aim on Miacao, Colombia. Miacao is a remote village in northern Colombia where the children have no access to any education and in August this year, Students for Charity is going to change that. With the support of a large charity organisation called Ankarstiftelsen that will help with the administration and running of the school after, the members of Students 4 Charity will travel to Miacao and build the school. We want to help them to make that happen!And do you know what the best thing is? Students 4 Charity don't need any administration fee or anything. 100% of what they're raising goes straight into to project and the kids down there in Columbia.ALRIGHT, I CAN AFFORD TO CHUCK IN A FEW BUCKS!WHAT do we want to do to change that? As Joseph and I are still students, trying to finish our degrees at the moment, we need to give something else other than money and we are more than happy to do so. Our plan is to draw attention towards these issues through this crazy idea and get as many supporters on board as we can. Everyone can help these children - especially you! 1800km northwards of Malmo, we will start the longest trip to school Sweden has ever seen! Four entire days of living in the wild, climbing Sweden's highest mountain and hike endless tracks whilst using only schoolbags and only what we can put inside these. All of this only to raise attention and get pictures around the globe that make people aware of this issue! That's the deal!Man that's awesome, I'd love to support you!WHAT'S the big deal I hear you say?  Usually for a trip such as this you would carry a large amount of equipment in a backpack that can hold anything up to 90litres. By using just a school bag we are limiting ourselves to around only 12litres of storage dramatically reducing the amount of equipment we can carry. Over a four-day hike it will take careful planning to carry only what we need to survive. We will have to forget most modern day luxuries that hikers are now used too.WHERE do we want to do that?  The aim is the Kebnekaise, Sweden's highest mountain massif which rises 2106m (6909ft) from the frozen Nordic ground. Being situated nearly 150km north of the border to the polar circle, the Kebnekaise consists of two summits offering one of northern Europe’s most magnificent views of Sweden. It is a dangerous peak often shrouded with bad weather and poor visability.Here, where the night lasts up to 19 hours during winter, and the snow of the arctic never really melts, people have made surviving possible through several huts along the way in case the weather changes too quickly.Serious, I always got a couple of bucks for that stuff!CAN we have some more details?

Day 1   Arriving in Kiruna, taking the Bus Nikkaluokta, camping somwhere in the wilderness 

Day 2   Getting up early, putting on the equipment and leaving for the 26km roundtrip to the summit and back

Day 3   Continuing hiking in the area

Day 4   Getting back to Kiruna and flying out to Stockholm

WHAT experience do you got?

Joseph as well as myself (Lucas) have been travelling/backpacking/hiking in many areas around the world to be confident enough to bring this attempt to success.

While I specifically have experience in climbing/mountaineering, Joseph is the Swedish mastermind behind all that. As a local he will make things easy, being used to the Swedish wilderness and - of course - the people.





HOW will you use the money raised?  

As we are trying to get as much money for a good cause together as we possibly can - of course, we will only deduct the travel expenses up to Kiruna, from where our journey starts. To be honest, as we both are still students and funding our lifes with part time jobs on little hours, that's the only way to do it. I hope you will understand this.

In case there is not enough for us being collected, we will donate the whole amount received by Students 4 Charity.




DON'T have anything on you just now? - There are many ways to help!  

Money isn’t the only support we need!

Share Share Share !! Isn't that the power these days anyway? Connect us to organisations, companies, small business or private sponsors that want to take part in it! Help us to create attention to the issue its self as well as our project No matter what becomes of this, THANK YOU for reading, donating or just thinking about two lads on a mountain in the polar circle with schoolbags! 

Much love.









Definitely gonna fund that!.: Follow our trip on FACEBOOK :.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Deutsche Version


*Unterstütze Charity*  

*4-tägige Wanderung im Polarkreis + Besteigung des höchsten Berges von Schweden*  

*ALL DAS MIT SCHULTORNISTERN*



Zwei Freunde, 4 Tage Wegstrecke im schwedischen Polarkreis und das alles nur mit Schultornistern! Wir machen das, weil wir daran glauben dass es einem guten Zweck dient!*VON DER STEUER ABSETZBAR*Einfach einen klick auf den Kasten neben deiner Emailadresse




.: Folge unserem Trip auf FACEBOOK :.WARUM würde man sowas machen wollen?
Auf der ganzen Welt gibt es Kinder, die dadurch, dass sie in entlegenen Regionen wohnen, täglich Stunden nur für den Schulweg auf sich nehmen müssen. Wir wollen helfen das zu ändern, indem wir Spenden für die schwedische Organisation Students 4 Charity sammeln, die weltweit Kindern dabei hilft, einen besseres Leben haben zu können. Warum? story:
Who We Are

The Rena’s Promise International Creative Writing Camp is a one week intensive writing program for young people between the ages of 14-17, who want to explore their own unique gifts as writers in prose and poetry, fiction and nonfiction in a camp setting with other serious teenage writers.

Created to further the vision of Holocaust survivor Rena Kornreich Gelissen and in honor of her memory, Rena’s promise is a promise to create a more ecumenical world unhindered by prejudice, racism or hatred by bringing young people together from all walks of life and providing them with a place to develop the cultural and creative voices of Generation NEXT.

Quinipet Retreat Center on Shelter Island is where our campers come to spend their week. Afternoons are a combination of meeting professional writers and enjoying all the Hamptons has to offer--swimming, kayaking, bonfires, cook outs and sleeping under the pines. This is a true sleep away camp experience devoted to giving young people the space to write and explore writing among like-minded people.

What We Need

Our budget is small--normally we raise 2,000.00 per year but last year we ran into the red and need to raise more money to support our scholarship fund. The largest portion of our budget goes to Quinipet Retreat Center, which provides a house, nursing facility and cafeteria. Our second largest expense if paying our professional writers to take a week out of their lives and come teach at our program and they teach two classes per day, offer one-on-one critiques and often give advice and references for college and scholarships. Lastly, we have insurance, field trips to theatre events and art museums, and transportation costs.
  • Full Scholarship for one camper is $1000.00--we give out 2 per year, but would like to have 5 this year, so we can reach more teens in need.
  • We give out 10-15 Partial Scholarships each year to campers giving $200-600.00 to each partial scholarship request.
  • We also try to support international students with either a full scholarship, so they only have to pay travel expenses.
  • All students accepted into camp immediately receive a $100.00 scholarship.

What You Get

  • Knowledge that young people who often come from difficult circumstances are in a place where they are supported emotionally and intellectually in a way they have probably not experienced before.
  • Comfort in knowing that inner city participants may not only be seeing a deer for the first time in their lives, but are writing about their lives in powerful and important ways.
  • Assurance that our writers are not censored and can express themselves in ways not normally allowed in secondary schools
  • Confidence that our writers are developing their voices, learning that their voices are important, and will take their voices into the world to make the world a better place
  • Peace in knowing that every camper is introduced to the idea of living together in peace and supporting each other despite economic and cultural differences--for many of our campers this is the first time they meet young people from other cultures and find a common thread and bond that is unbreakable.
  • Tax Write Off for you charitable donation

Our Impact

For many of our scholarship students this is their first time in America or in a rural setting. We have welcomed writers from South Africa and Wales, Canada and China.

  • Help inner city writers get out of the city and enjoy living on the water in absolute paradise;
  • Help talented young writers coming economic hardship find support for their dreams;
  • Offer rigorous workshops that challenge our writers;
  • Introduce our young writers to professional writers from all over the world;
  • Teach our writers ways to use writing to impact their lives and ours;
  • Help with college applications and references so our campers can expanding their conceptual horizons, for some they are the first in their families to go to college

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Some of our campers do not have computers, they work on one laptops that we provide to them, but we could use a few more.
  • Share our campaign with your friends on FB and Twitter:)
  • We don't need a lot of money and every little bit helps!

Shalom!

story:
"The reader lives a thousand lives before he dies. The man who never reads lives only one"


WHY WE DO IT AND HOW WE GONNA DO IT


Reading a good book opens your mind to a whole new world full of ideas, imagination, and life. Many people, especially the young ones, have yet to cultivate a reading habit. 

And together, we are about to change that.

Never underestimate the power of books to change a person's worldview. What separates the society is not ability but opportunity. Therefore I seek to provide opportunity and access to read good books to the students of my alma mater, Penang Free School. I want to make it easier for people to find and afford good books. Instead of waiting for them to go to the library, the library will come to them. 

My first priority is to provide good books. I will go to bookstores and surf the net for affordable books, new and used. I will be very selective in choosing the books because the goal is not to give books, but to instill a habit of reading good books which will inspire the readers, develop their critical thinking and most importantly, inculcate the love of wisdom. The books are a means to an end.

My second priority, if I raise enough funding, will be to build a mini-library in my school. Mini-library has gathered much interest in the U.S and U.K. It is relatively new in Malaysia and can be a creative addition to the community. The school has a library but I think we will attract more students to read if we ‘move’ the library to them. I will attempt to get the school's approval and discuss the logistics with the headmaster, Mr Jalil Saad, and gather a team to build the mini-library and place it in an area convenient and accessible to the students. This is a pilot-project and if successful, I hope to help make mini-libraries in Penang streets.


TAKE ACTION


Give so that others can receive. If you are reading this, someone must have contributed to your education. This is an opportunity to pay it forward and contribute to someone else's education. 

Financial contribution is the easiest and most straightforward help you can give. I also accept book donations and volunteers to help build the mini-library but the main drive of this campaign is fundraising. Contact me if you want to give books or/and volunteer your time.


WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO


You want to see results and impacts. I will post regular updates and photos of purchased books and proof of transaction. You want to make your contribution matters. Here is a sketch of post-campaign developments:

*If raise between $100 and $150, the school will receive books only.

*Between $150 and $250, books and mini-library.

*Between $250 and $400, another school, orphanage or library will receive books.

*More than $400, I will lobby for more mini-libraries to be implemented either in another school or in a popular street in Penang. Collaboration with friends from other schools and local ADUN (State Representative) or MP (Member of Parliament) can make this happen.

Many people, especially the young ones, have yet to cultivate a reading habit. And together, we are about to change that.Never underestimate the power of books to change a person's worldview. What separates the society is not ability but opportunity. Therefore I seek to provide opportunity and access to read good books to the students of my alma mater, Penang Free School. I want to make it easier for people to find and afford good books. Instead of waiting for them to go to the library, the library will come to them. My first priority is to provide good books. I will go to bookstores and surf the net for affordable books, new and used. I will be very selective in choosing the books because the goal is not to give books, but to instill a habit of reading good books which will inspire the readers, develop their critical thinking and most importantly, inculcate the love of wisdom. The books are a means to an end.My second priority, if I raise enough funding, will be to build a mini-library in my school. Mini-library has gathered much interest in the U.S and U.K. It is relatively new in Malaysia and can be a creative addition to the community. The school has a library but I think we will attract more students to read if we ‘move’ the library to them. I will attempt to get the school's approval and discuss the logistics with the headmaster, Mr Jalil Saad, and gather a team to build the mini-library and place it in an area convenient and accessible to the students. This is a pilot-project and if successful, I hope to help make mini-libraries in Penang streets.TAKE ACTIONGive so that others can receive. If you are reading this, someone must have contributed to your education. This is an opportunity to pay it forward and contribute to someone else's education. Financial contribution is the easiest and most straightforward help you can give. I also accept book donations and volunteers to help build the mini-library but the main drive of this campaign is fundraising. Contact me if you want to give books or/and volunteer your time.WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GOYou want to see results and impacts. I will post regular updates and photos of purchased books and proof of transaction. You want to make your contribution matters. Here is a sketch of post-campaign developments:*If raise between $100 and $150, the school will receive books only.*Between $150 and $250, books and mini-library.*Between $250 and $400, another school, orphanage or library will receive books.*More than $400, I will lobby for more mini-libraries to be implemented either in another school or in a popular street in Penang. Collaboration with friends from other schools and local ADUN (State Representative) or MP (Member of Parliament) can make this happen.

story:
We are looking for 9,000 people who are ready to give just a dollar for this campaign. For just a dollar, you can help children aged between 5-9 years attend school. There are many young children in the rural Kenya who are suffering from jigger infestation. According to the findings that led to this campaign, we realized that there are many children who stay at home and cannot attend school due to the jiggers infestation. We decided to give these children hope and a future by raising money to help get rid of the jiggers and send them to school.


These children cannot be able to walk and they cannot participate in extra-curricular activities since the jigger infestation has advanced to severe stages. Given the kind of pain that such young children are going through, we opted to seek for people who will share a dollar with them for a better life.

The future belongs to the young and we who are capable should rise up and help those in need. A dollar to some people is nothing but to someone else it is something worth dying for. We need it as is something to us.

We need help from well wishers who want to help make the world a better place for the young generation in Kenya by just sparing a dollar. You don't have to be rich to make a difference while you can touch the life of a child with only $1.

All the collected funds will go towards acquiring the following items that are required for effective results: 200 pcs Dettol disinfectant, 200 pcs clean towels, 200 pairs of gloves, 200 pcs washing basins and 200 pairs of shoes. Also, this will help to cater for transport charges.

We are in talks with an anti-jigger organization with the aim of helping to carry out the exercise effectively. 

You can read more about jiggers and their impact here.

Kindly share this with your friends and lets us make the world a better place for each and everyone of us. I am making that difference, are you?

story:
A big thanks to our 62 donors!  

 The money raise will allow us to continue raising awareness for the good samaritan law and save lives!


Broken No More wants to raise awareness about California's 911 Good Samaritan Law, which we lobbied to bring into effect on January 1, 2013. 

Your donations will go directly towards a sustained awareness media campaign throughout all major cities in California, with billboards like this one, allowing us to reach millions of people.

105 people die every single day of accidental drug overdose in the US.  Many die because they are abandoned by those who were with them at the time, because they failed to receive emergency care.

Hello, my name is Denise Cullen. In August 2008 my husband and I lost Jeff, our only child, to an accidental drug overdose at the age of 27, after a 6 month period of sobriety.  He died alone, on the grass of an upscale residential neighborhood in Costa Mesa. His death led us to start Broken No More, a Non Profit Organization dedicated to educate the public on how the law protects bystanders in the event of a drug overdose, and change harmful drug policies by shifting the focus from criminalization to public health.

Before losing my son, I worked with terminally ill AIDS patients as a Clinical Social Worker.  Through this work, I learned that providing someone with the proper knowledge can increase their chance of survival. Every life is worth saving. 

The Good Samaritan 911 Law provides that if someone calls 911 or takes a person to an emergency room for a potentially fatal OD, they cannot be arrested or prosecuted for being in possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or for being under the influence of drugs.  However, there is no protection for driving under the influence or any other crime, or for parole or probation violations or warrants either.  The same protection goes for the OD victim--they don't go to jail for drugs, paraphernalia, or being under the influence.  Yet few people know of the existence of this law, and a person who has been using drugs may not call for fear of legal repercussion, while law enforcement personnel still unjustly arrest people who this law is meant to protect.  

With your help, our campaign will educate all parties to the existence of this law and potentially save lives!

Had this law existed in 2008 my son might still be alive.

Our Immediate Goal

  • Broken No More has partnered up with 10K Advertising, a Los Angeles based  outdoor media company who frequently works with Non Profits, taking advantage of remnant media inventory throughout Southern California, so that our message can reach the largest possible audience. A well placed billboard can generate up to 1,000,000+ impressions in a  four week period. A single bus bench, upwards of 30,000. The more funds are raised, the more people can be reached, the more lives can be saved.

Our Impact

  • Accidental drug overdoses are the #1 cause of unintentional injury deaths across the US, more so than motor vehicle crashes. Car crashes have been reduced by investing in safety measures for drivers. We want to use a similar approach in dealing with drug related incidents and focus on prevention. 
  • Drug use affects 1 in 4 American families and that number is on the rise.  Every fatal overdose leaves a family, friends and community grieving for their tragic loss.  We can make a difference by making life saving information accessible to everyone.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, then please help us get the word out. Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other social platform you use.
  • You can learn about organizations that are working to reverse the harms caused  by drug use such as the Drug Policy Alliance, Broken No More, GRASP, the Chicago Recovery Alliance, and the Harm Reduction Coalition.
  • And If you don’t know what the 911 Good Samaritan law is in our state, go here to find out

Prior Campaign Succeses

  • In 2012, Broken No More participated in a fund raising effort for Naloxone - a commonly used overdose reversal drug. The medication was in short supply and cost was extremely high. The campaign was able to raise $10,000 and save countless lives!

Thank you.

Prior Campaign Succeses

Thank you.

story:
My name is Maria Munayer.  My husband, Ted Young, and I recently visited the beautiful country of Kenya from our home state of California.  We wanted to give back to Kenya's children to support the future of this developing nation.  Our mission was to provide humanitarian assistance to a primary school in the remote bush area of the Maasai Mara.  With the generous donations from our community in the San Francisco Bay Area, we were able to deliver 200 pounds of school and medical supplies and hundreds of textbooks and writing booklets for the pupils. (See video)

Upon our arrival to the school, the pupils were signaled to come in from recess when the Headmistress used a stick to bang on a rusted old wheel hanging from a tree.  We told the Headmistress that it would be our honor to send them a school bell loud enough to call the children in from recess and to alert the children staying in the nearby villages when school was starting. The Headmistress was deeply touched and said her pupils have never heard the sound of a bell.

To ensure the students attend class and our protected from the wild animals, most of the school's 400 pupils sleep at the school on blankets and receive one bowl of porridge a day.  We were so inspired by the efforts of the Loigero School to provide an education in a safe and nurturing environment.

The large brass bell is $200 and the shipping to Nairobi is $500.  My husband and I would like to pay for the engraving to include the name of each donor as a tribute to their generous contribution.  Wishing you and your family many blessings in 2014.

story:
What is the SIUE Science & Engineering Challenge?

The SIUE Science & Engineering Challenge engages more than 300 fifth through twelfth grade local students to spark their curiosity, stimulate their imaginations, provide hands on experience and utilize independent critical thinking skills while working on projects and research in a competition format.  While working on projects, students learn to apply the scientific method which includes observing, inferring, measuring, collecting data, and forming conclusions to interpret interactions between experimental variables.  The students become aware of the interdisciplinary nature of science as they apply not only reading and writing skills, but also mathematics and art to communicate their research findings.  This unique educational opportunity enables students to understand that science is an integral part of life.  The Challenge culminates in a one day event on the campus of SIUE where young students compete individually and in teams on projects in categories that include Applied Math & Physics, Biological Sciences, Chemistry, Engineering, Earth Sciences and Consumer Sciences.
 
The Challenge has been taking place on the campus of SIUE for the last 31 years, providing a STEM outlet for more than 20,800 participating students. The Challenge is open to nearly 60,000 young students annually in the following counties of Southwest Illinois (Madison, Bond, Calhoun, Clinton, Jersey, Macoupin, Monroe, Montgomery, St. Clair and Washington).
 
20 students that have participated in the Challenge have gone on to present at the prestigious Intel International Science and Engineering Fair, many of whom have won awards, including Connor Ruhl and Channing Hunter in 2013, who placed 4th in the category of Computer Science.  The Challenge is one of only six qualifying events in the entire state of Illinois for the Intel International Science and Engineering Fair.

The Challenge is unique because it coordinates a large number of schools, in a region that needs the support, to enhance their experiential learning for STEM subjects. It also encourages students to create new and unique knowledge which can solve existing problems and enhance the world we live in.


We Need Your Support

The SIUE Science and Engineering Challenge needs to raise $20,000 to host the competition.  We're looking to raise funds to support next year's competition.  Below is our budget for the Challenge, so that you can see exactly where your support will be spent.


Supporters of the SIUE Science and Engineering Challenge will be rewarded with some nice incentives.


$10 gift will receive an SIUE STEM Center THANK YOU card (110 Available)
$20 gift will receive an SIUE Cougar Paw Print Note Pad (120 Available)
$50 gift will receive a STEM Center set of Note Flags (50 Available)
$100 gift will receive a STEM Center Flash Drive (50 Available)
$500 gift will receive a 3-D print of the asteroid Vesta (10 Available)
$1,000 gift will receive a 3-D print of a Buckyball Molecule (5 Available)
$5,000 gift will receive a 3-D print of your own choosing or a build-your-own Galileo Telescope kit (2 Available)

All funds raised, regardless of whether or not we reach our goal, will go directly to support the 2016 SIUE Science and Engineering Challenge.

The Impact

STEM education is critical to the advancement of our country and the greatest difficulty is providing STEM opportunities in rural areas like southwestern Illinois and impoverished urban centers like East St. Louis.

According to Education Week Magazine, opportunities to learn about STEM are lacking at rural schools.  Rural districts lack access to extracurricular activities, which support STEM and can build interest and skills in students.

The U.S. Department of Education denotes that growth among most professional fields will increase by 14% from 2010 to 2020, but STEM field opportunities will grow at an average rate of 34%.

This isn’t just a local issue, it’s a national issue that we are addressing at the local level.  Providing our youth with an opportunity to conduct research and showcase their results helps to fill this gap. 

The SIUE Science and Engineering Challenge has been taking place on the campus of SIUE for the last 31 years, providing an extracurricular STEM outlet for more than 21,000 participating students in southwestern Illinois. 

In that time, SIUE has seen a dramatic increase in enrollment for students in STEM fields on campus.  In the past eight years, the Engineering program has seen a 59% increase in enrollment, the Mathematics department has seen a 40% increase in enrollment since 2001 and the Biological Science Department has seen an increase of 94% in enrollment from 2003-2010.  These figures show the value of providing young students the opportunity to conduct research and learn about STEM opportunities.

The Challenge enhances the academic experience for students that participate with a hands-on project.  The Challenge provides students with a high quality interactive educational learning experience.  It empowers them by working independently on research in fields that can generate new knowledge and make the world a better place.  It creates accountability and fosters competition which are key to enhancing management skills.


Risks & Challenges

There is currently a great deal of uncertainty about the financial future of the State of Illinois.  We currently have no state budget and a number of important community outreach programs, like the Challenge have been funded by state appropriations dollars in the past.  The University is having to focus on its mission of educating the students that we enroll, and all of our funding is being directed to make sure that we continue to provide an excellent education to our students.  Unfortunately, it means that events like the Challenge are going to need to be supported in other ways or they will no longer exist.  We don't want that to happen and that is why we are asking for your support!

Other Ways You Can Help

While funding the Challenge to ensure its existence is our highest priority, we also need the help of volunteers to run the event.  If you're a STEM professional and would be interested in being a judge, or if you would like to assist the coordination and running of the event, please contact Dawn Olive at (618) 650-3065.

story:
I am Dakota Collins a senior at Lawrence High School. I am planning on going to Italy and Greece in June 2016. I have raised money for a China trip I did in 2013-2014, so I am very confident that I can raise the money for this new experience. This trip is a little more expensive than China though, so I am receiving help from a teacher at my school named Mr. Platt who does educational trips through EF Tours.

I appreciate traveling because you see the world in a different light. You get to see the privileges United States citizens have that others do not. I also want to show other kids that even though you are not privileged with the financial means to travel you can still be ambitious and overcome obstacles to have awesome experiences in life.

I believe this trip will benefit me because it is important to understand the world better. I aspire to become an Interior Designer and this to Rome and Athens will inspire me and help me with a future art driven career.

Thank you in advance for your donation,

Dakota Collins

story:
Who Are We?

Student2Student’s purpose is to balance the scales of the inequity in the public education system, where the supporting resources are directly proportional to the financial health of the respective community, using the power and passion of youth. With both a tutoring and a mentoring program, Student2Student’s goal is to create a program that instills respect, in addition to other core values that will support minorities to take pride in their culture and succeed further in life.

We provide tutoring and mentoring on a reliable schedule using near-peer pairings both in person and online in the Greater Philadelphia area. 

Our programs include sending students and mentors to schools, after-school care centers, and other youth-oriented facilities that are easily accessible, as well as an online element based on convenience.

We will emphasize the importance of proper preparation for transitions between various levels of education. For example, programs will target the transition between elementary and middle school, middle school and high school, and high school to college. Our proactive efforts intend to provide the following positive outcomes: keeping young students of color focused on their education, lowering the rates of violence and arrest conviction, increasing the rate of enrollment in colleges and universities among minorities, and graduate young men and women from high school and college and empower them to join the labor market and/or different businesses.

Mentoring and tutoring will be conducted through a voluntary basis. Mentors and tutors will go through training to make sure that they qualify to be a part of the growth of the young men and women who are enrolled in the program.

The end result would be for every student who comes through the program to gain a sense of love for learning and support needed to increase the likelihood that a successful future is achievable. We want to motivate and push the youth to want to work towards excellence in all aspects of their lives and to let them know that setbacks can be a part of the process, but that they should never give up. We want to help these young children expand the rate of graduation from high school to get into college, and not only to obtain a college degree but also change the perspective of minorities, and the perception of them by others. By doing this it will hopefully start a generational trend that will be much more positive than the current one.

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the money will go to helping the children in our program. The funds will be used for:

- Educational trips

- School supplies

- Starting a scholarship fund

- Transportation costs

- Food for meetings

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to funds, we are looking for volunteers to help out our mission. If you are in the Greater Philadelphia area, in the age range of 14-25, and willing to volunteer your time to tutor or mentor, we would love your help! If this doesn't describe you, we can still use your help! Just contact us at s2sprograms@gmail.com if you want to help with tutoring, or ojtfmentoring@yahoo.com if you'd like to help with mentoring.
