With both a tutoring and a mentoring program, Student2Student’s goal is to create a program that instills respect, in addition to other core values that will support minorities to take pride in their culture and succeed further in life.


We provide tutoring and mentoring on a reliable schedule using near-peer pairings both in person and online in the Greater Philadelphia area. 


Our programs include sending students and mentors to schools, after-school care centers, and other youth-oriented facilities that are easily accessible, as well as an online element based on convenience.


We will emphasize the importance of proper preparation for transitions between various levels of education. For example, programs will target the transition between elementary and middle school, middle school and high school, and high school to college. Our proactive efforts intend to provide the following positive outcomes: keeping young students of color focused on their education, lowering the rates of violence and arrest conviction, increasing the rate of enrollment in colleges and universities among minorities, and graduate young men and women from high school and college and empower them to join the labor market and/or different businesses.


Mentoring and tutoring will be conducted through a voluntary basis. Mentors and tutors will go through training to make sure that they qualify to be a part of the growth of the young men and women who are enrolled in the program.


The end result would be for every student who comes through the program to gain a sense of love for learning and support needed to increase the likelihood that a successful future is achievable. We want to motivate and push the youth to want to work towards excellence in all aspects of their lives and to let them know that setbacks can be a part of the process, but that they should never give up. We want to help these young children expand the rate of graduation from high school to get into college, and not only to obtain a college degree but also change the perspective of minorities, and the perception of them by others. By doing this it will hopefully start a generational trend that will be much more positive than the current one.
   What We Need & What You Get 100% of the money will go to helping the children in our program. The funds will be used for:
- Educational trips
- School supplies
- Starting a scholarship fund
- Transportation costs
- Food for meetings

    
Other Ways You Can Help

 In addition to funds, we are looking for volunteers to help out our mission. If you are in the Greater Philadelphia area, in the age range of 14-25, and willing to volunteer your time to tutor or mentor, we would love your help! If this doesn't describe you, we can still use your help! Just contact us at s2sprograms@gmail.com if you want to help with tutoring, or ojtfmentoring@yahoo.com if you'd like to help with mentoring.

story:
Give the Gift of Legal Outreach...

Each year, Legal Outreach turns away countless students who have the motivation and drive to join Legal Outreach because of lack of funding. With your help, we can change this. 

As a mentor, I'm fundraising this December to make it possible for more students like my mentee to go through Legal Outreach.  

                                       

Mentoring Program 

Legal Outreach works with students from underserved neighborhoods around NYC and prepares them to succeed in high school, college, and beyond.  A key part of this is LO's mentoring program. 

Each sophomore, junior, and senior in Legal Outreach is paired with an attorney mentor. As mentors of seniors through LO, we provide students with support, inspire them to aim high, and offer them a picture of a career path open to them. 

Legal Outreach is a meaningful way for me to give back to underserved youth in NYC, and this holiday season, I want to Give the Gift of LO to more NYC youth.

Your Support Will... 

Make it possible for more students to be accepted into and complete Legal Outreach. Students gain four years of free programming, including a debate program, SAT prep, writing classes, mentoring by attorneys, college application workshops, and much more! 

Of the students LO supports: 

  • 100% graduate HS on time (only 66% of NYC public school students do) 
  • 99% go on to competitive colleges and universities 

How You Can Help 

  • Donate to our campaign before December 31st, 2014 
  • Share our campaign on social media 
  • Encourage your networks to support  

This holiday season, you can Give the Gift of LO and change the educational trajectory of a young person's life. 

#GivetheGiftofLO 
www.legaloutreach.org
www.facebook.com/legaloutreach
@legaloutreach

story:
McRae-Gaines Learning Center, 1978 to present

McRae-Gaines Learning Center is an historic school founded in 1978 in Selma, Alabama, to serve “the least to the greatest…” Since McRae-Gaines opened its doors, the teachers and staff at McRae have committed more than just their time and talents to the children who have filed through their classrooms. All three of the Directors have worked tirelessly during their tenures to fulfill the mission of the school, often foregoing their own salaries in order to make ends meet. And the teachers themselves have gone without pay to ensure that the children received the quality education designed by the Founding Directors in “Pathway to College,” the McRae curriculum.

In spite of a precarious financial situation throughout its almost 40 year history the school’s contribution to confident and prepared students in their continued education is measurable and significant.  Graduates from McRae-Gaines have continued their studies in colleges and universities throughout the United States.  Today, these students serve their communities as teachers, lawyers, doctors, engineers, architects, community developers, government officials and in many other professions.

Our Request

Every since we took over governance of McRae-Gaines in 2012 as a fully invested Board of Directors, we have labored to make sure our teachers are paid for their work. This year we want to do something special for them with a Christmas surprise. You can make that happen by helping us raise an extra $6,000 by December 10, 2014 toward our December payroll.

The economy in the Black Belt of Alabama has struggled since the 1990s. Unemployment is at 17.6% and our parents work hard to pay their tuition – our main source of income. But you and I know that Christmas is going to be difficult as they shop for their children’s Christmas and they may well decide to delay payment. We want to be ready for that and to guarantee our teachers and staff a very Merry Christmas and a Happy Holiday as well!

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you in advance for your generous donation. We know that some people simply can't donate but can help in other ways.

You can help us make and exceed our goal by forwarding this appeal to friends and family via email, Facebook, Twitter and/or Instagram. Be our Christmas Bell, our Christmas Carole, our Christmas Angel - and proclaim the word by December 10, 2014 that, "We love our teachers and staff and we want to show how very important they are to us!" 

We wish you a very Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays!

The McRae-Gaines Board Directors

story:
ANNOUNCEMENT: THE GOAL HAS BEEN REACHED BUT THERE IS STILL 48 HOURS TO GET YOUR SWAG AND #HELPBUILDWONDER!


With the help of more than 420 generous supporters, we are one huge step closer to building Wonder! And we are so excited.

Thank you again for helping build the Crawl exhibit in Wonder!

Thank you for making the Wonder Gallery possible!

If you have any questions please contact Laura at lmilks@scienceworld.ca or 604.443.7489 


ANNOUNCEMENT: DR. SCOTT TALKS DINOSAURS! WILL BE HELD ON SEPTEMBER 14, 2016 @6:00pm

DO YOU HAVE A BABY SHOWER COMING UP OR WANT TO DRESS YOUR LITTLE ONE UP TO SUPPORT THE WONDER GALLERY. 
GET YOUR WONDER ONESIES NOW. 
   



Why WONDER? The first 5 years of life are the most important to set the foundation for learning later in life. Providing a positive interactive environment is essential for cognitive development and Wonder will be a state-of-the-art gallery that will introduce a love for learning to thousands of children.

Wonder will be a new gallery at Science World at TELUS World of Science in Vancouver. Science World is a charitable organization that inspires children and youth to Wonder about science and technology.

With your help, we can create a space for children to play, learn and explore—empowering them to look at the world around them with Wonder . The Wonder Gallery will focus on infants to children 5 years old. A new Crawl space exhibit will focus on children 0-2 years old and will be safe space just for them, 
and you can help build it! 

- "Looking to the future, Science World’s newest space, the imaginative Wonder Gallery, will certainly be a reminder of Expo’s spirit of innovation and the sense of community it created." - VanCity Buzz

Science World is a non-profit charitable organization that relies on donors to build galleries.  Admission fees provide the foundation of Science World's operating budget and support core functions such as maintenance, building operation and programming. To create projects like Wonder the generosity of donors is needed. In other words, Science World won't be able to build the Wonder Gallery without the participation of Indiegogo supporters like you.


Thousands of children visit Science World each week and leave wondering about the science around them. Wonder  will nurture a child's development across their first five years (including motor, social and language skills) while encouraging them to learn about basic principles of STEAM—science, technology, engineering, arts and mathematics. 

To encourage active parental involvement in these child-led explorations, parents and caregivers will be provided opportunities to discover and learn more about early childhood development.

Currently, $947,213.61 has been raised, of the $2,000,000 needed, in order to bring Wonder to life. This crowdfunding campaign will start its focus on building the corral area, in the Crawl space exhibit, for babies and children to play safely.

Crawl will be filled with fun, developmentally appropriate activities and a corral area where babies can safely play without interruption from active toddlers and kids throughout the gallery.



 

In 1977, Barbara Brink started a traveling outreach program to make science literacy fun and accessible. In January 1982, she helped open the Arts, Sciences & Technology Centre (ASTC) downtown Vancouver, attracting over 600,000 visitors and continuing to reach out to over 400,000 children all over British Columbia.  

May 2, 2016 marks the 30th anniversary of Expo 86, a transportation and communications World's Fair. Once Expo 86 closed its doors on October 13, 1986, Barbara began lobbying to relocate ASTC into the  Expo 86 centre. After a lengthy campaign, donations came in from all over through government sectors including federal, provincial and municipal, the private sector, foundations and individuals raising over $19 million to transform the Expo 86 centre into Canada's beloved Science World British Columbia. 

Thank you Barbara Brink, for reaching out and inspiring children all over British Columbia. Thank you TELUS, one of our biggest supporters for believing in what we do. Thank you Canada, British Columbia and Vancouver. Thank you to all of our Community Partners.  Thank you for believing in Barbara's Eureka! moment and for what Science World continues to do. You help inspire children to Wonder about the science around them. It all begins with Wonder. 

#HelpBuildWonder

Thank you for your support and empowering Sully and thousands of children to look at the world around them with Wonder!
You can also help by sharing this page http://ow.ly/4naANf with your friends and family and by clicking

story:
In 2013, Black Skeptics Los Angeles (BSLA), a 501c3 organization, spearheaded its First in the Family Humanist Scholarship initiative, which focuses on providing resources to undocumented, foster care, homeless and LGBTQ youth who will be the first in their families to go to college.  Responding directly to the school-to-prison pipeline crisis in communities of color, BSLA is the first atheist organization to specifically address college pipelining for youth of color with an explicitly anti-racist multicultural emphasis. If current prison pipelining trends persist the Education Trust estimates that only “one of every 20 African American kindergartners will graduate from a four-year California university” in the next decade.  In addition:

  • The school-to-prison pipeline disproportionately locks up African American and Latino youth, leaving many with criminal records and no possibility of “re-entry” to employment, housing or higher education
  • African American youth are severely over-represented in foster care, homelesspopulations, and juvenile jails

  • Foster care and homeless youth of color have some of the lowest rates of college transfer and graduation amongst college youth populations
  • LGBTQ youth of color have disproportionately high suspension/expulsion and push-out rates in U.S. public schools
  • Black females are consistently suspended at greater rates than ALL OTHER groups besides black males
  • So-called inner city schools have fewer Advanced Placement, college prep and honors courses and highly qualified STEM teachers than their white suburban counterparts

With your support, we hope to award at least four youth $1000 scholarships to assist with their books, tuition, housing and other living expenses.  Our 2013-2015 scholars are now at USC, UCLA, UC Riverside, Cal State University Long Beach, Babson College, University of North Texas, UC Merced and El Camino College.  
BSLA and our alum also thank our previous supporters: Freedom from Religion Foundation, American Humanist Association, Atheists United, Black Non-Believers, Minority Atheists of Michigan and more!

story:
Who we are:

Schools4Future is a Social Business Venture aiming at creating the first schooling opportunity for children from slums in India. Official figures estimate that approximately 165 million people live in slums on the Indian subcontinent, with more than 65 million children being without education and growing up in a difficult environment full of waste such as plastic and aluminium. In fact, more than 6000 tons of plastic trash are dumped in India suburbs every day and are not recycled, but burnt. Children from these backgrounds have one fate: being waste pickers and a life in poverty!

  • we are a team of social entrepreneurs from Europe and North America with previous experience in emerging markets such as CEE and India. 
  • Education4Trash: Schools4Future will build schools and parents can send their children to school by paying the tuition fee of 15 USD (including education and food) either in cash or in trash! 
  • S4F will build 40 schools in Bangalore as well as a recycling plant. The recycled plastic will be sold to manufacturing companies, financing the schools and generating profits for further expansion across India. The first year of operations with 40 schools will allow 60.000 children the access to free education!
  • By 2020: Schools4Future will be India's biggest affordable education provider in India, with more than 2.5 million children in our schools - breaking a viscous circle! 

Our project was developed by practitioners, academics, researchers from various fields such as business, finance, education, and teaching - allowing us to create a sustainable approach of affordable education in India and across other emerging economies.


What will we do with your money?

Your money will be spent in the creation of a social business and will not be a normal donation as to so many NGOs or charities!

  • Construction of 40 schools for children of all backgrounds! Free access, regardless of gender, age, race or other criteria - everyone is welcome in our schools!
  • Construction of 1 recycling plant to cross finance our operations!
  • Change Education in the most sustainable way you could imagine: instead of continuously donating money for education to charities, we create business that will grant access to education to more children than any other organisation world wide! 
  • by 2020: 2.5 million students, 90.000 teachers, 10.000 recycling or support staff employees - fair wages and a cleaner environment!
The initial 130.000 $ will be used for the construction of the first schools. Additional funding will be available via organizations, trusts, and NGOs. The more this Crowd-Funding yields, the more schools will be immediately funded and the project can commence even quicker!

Consequences:

Changing education, changing equality, creating a more sustainable platform for international growth!

  • An investment in knowledge pays the best interest
  • Money should not be an entrance barrier for Knowledge and education! However, costs cannot be denied:  We charge a currency our customers are sufficiently endowed with - trash!

Challenges:

India is an emerging economy with very different cultural aspects. Our team has previously worked in India and has connected with several governmental institutions as well as corporate company partly funding our operations, allowing us to overcome entrance barriers!

  • Your support will help to accelerate the start of the company in July 2015 with the first children in December 2015!

Other means to help: 

Spread the news of this social venture and create awareness - many people knwo that poverty is an issue and think that donating can help! In fact vast amountso f donations are misused and spent for administration. Our company ensures that all resources are used as efficiently as possible! Spread the news of this new approach!

  • visit and share our website: www.schools4future.com 
  • visit and share our facebook, instragram, and twitter acconts!
  • stay connected and follow our progress of changing affordable education in the 21st century, whilst protecting our environment.

Our children, mothers and fathers will be happy and will share their experience soon with you !

story:
Hello ,
I am Minoru Chou, Business Co-Captain of the Winner's Circle Robotics Team, a new FIRST Robotics Competition team starting up at Manual and Southern High Schools in Louisville, KY. Our goal is to teach kids how to work together to engineer a 140-pound remote-controlled robot in six weeks that can compete against other teams from around the US and even the world. As an FRC startup team, we will need the kind of supplies and equipment required to run both a startup business and a machine shop.
There are many perks for funding this team, but most of all, you're helping our 50+ students receive a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Not many students have the opportunity to receive the hands-on experience of building a robot and running a "tech business" at such a young age!
You are giving us a chance to enjoy and have fun competing with robots that we build as a team.
On behalf of the team, I would like to thank everyone for their help and support!

What We Need & What You Get

  • This year our costs are expected to exceed $30,000. So far we've raised $12,000.
  • Costs include robot parts, computers, software, power tools, promotional materials, registration fees, travel expenses, and team t-shirts. To compete in  two qualifying tournaments and the world championship this year, we will have to pay over $10,000 in registration fees alone.
  • We have many perks! Companies may have their logos and names posted on many of our goods, including our newsletter, t-shirts, banner and robot. We have team buttons, t-shirts, pens, a newsletter and Hexbot robots to share with our supporters.

The Impact

    The Winner's Circle Robotics Team teaches students to design, CAD, build, wire, program, and compete with robots by working with 20 professional engineers from GE, University of Louisville, Purdue University, Big Ass Solutions, and local makers and inventors. We will be working with SCORE volunteers and the Kentucky Innovation Network to create a winning business plan. Our students are receiving an early education in engineering and business that can help them succeed in the future, and who knows, they might invent a machine someday that will contribute to society and even help you!

Other Ways You Can Help

 Please share and spread the word! Just spreading the word helps in tremendous ways! If you're in the Louisville area, donations of tools and equipment are always appreciated. We're especially in need of a storage trailer to borrow while we wait for our workshop to be completed.
story_txt:
Hello ,I am Minoru Chou, Business Co-Captain of the Winner's Circle Robotics Team, a new FIRST Robotics Competition team starting up at Manual and Southern High Schools in Louisville, KY. Our goal is to teach kids how to work together to engineer a 140-pound remote-controlled robot in six weeks that can compete against other teams from around the US and even the world. As an FRC startup team, we will need the kind of supplies and equipment required to run both a startup business and a machine shop.There are many perks for funding this team, but most of all, you're helping our 50+ students receive a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Not many students have the opportunity to receive the hands-on experience of building a robot and running a "tech business" at such a young age!You are giving us a chance to enjoy and have fun competing with robots that we build as a team. On behalf of the team, I would like to thank everyone for their help and support!
  What We Need & What You Get 
This year our costs are expected to exceed $30,000. So far we've raised $12,000.

Costs include robot parts, computers, software, power tools, promotional materials, registration fees, travel expenses, and team t-shirts. To compete in  two qualifying tournaments and the world championship this year, we will have to pay over $10,000 in registration fees alone.
 We have many perks! Companies may have their logos and names posted on many of our goods, including our newsletter, t-shirts, banner and robot. We have team buttons, t-shirts, pens, a newsletter and Hexbot robots to share with our supporters. 
  The Impact 
The Winner's Circle Robotics Team teaches students to design, CAD, build, wire, program, and compete with robots by working with 20 professional engineers from GE, University of Louisville, Purdue University, Big Ass Solutions, and local makers and inventors. We will be working with SCORE volunteers and the Kentucky Innovation Network to create a winning business plan. Our students are receiving an early education in engineering and business that can help them succeed in the future, and who knows, they might invent a machine someday that will contribute to society and even help you!

  Other Ways You Can Help  Please share and spread the word! Just spreading the word helps in tremendous ways! If you're in the Louisville area, donations of tools and equipment are always appreciated. We're especially in need of a storage trailer to borrow while we wait for our workshop to be completed.

story:
Our Purpose

The Earthrise Space Foundation is all about Science, Technology, Engineering, & Math (STEM) outreach and we want to promote STEM education using Sagan. Sagan has been designed so that while we prepare him for his trip to the moon he can teach students of all ages in the topics of robotics, space, and engineering. The Earthrise Space Foundation has personally hosted over 80 interns and has reached out to over 500 middle and high school students, providing them with valuable work experience in the expanding field of space exploration.

We realize that STEM education is not being promoted enough to young children and students. As a way of solving this problem we are launching this campaign and will be using Sagan to educate people in a fun and creative way. This is a story of a robot and his creator Carla as they go on an adventure to the moon. Although it seems like a simple children's book, Sagan's Quest is educational and will spark an interest in STEM for not only young children but everyone who reads it! This book is sure to become an instant classic once it's released!

How The Funds Will Be Used


Earthrise Space Foundation Accomplishments to Date

The Foundation is proud of its numerous accomplishments. Some of these are listed below:

  • Provided support to senior level students’ projects, at the University of Central Florida (UCF), to design spacecraft hardware.
  • Engaged over 80 interns with the assistance of Workforce Central Florida and UCF.
  • Reached out to over 500 middle and high school students through facility tours, presentations and outreach programs.
  • Involved in workshops and networking events to help advance the technology community and provide experience to both personnel and students.
  • Awarded the Congressional Rising Star in Technology in 2013 by Congressman Bill Posey in recognition of the success and benefit to the regional technology community.

3D Render Concept of Sagan


Take a Sneak Peak of Our Book!

*We will release the first 10 pages of the story through the campaign. The entire book will be available by November 2014.


Sagan's Quest is going to be a book series! Our first book is in the final stages of its production and details Carla's creation of Sagan and her inspiration to send him to the moon. The second book in our series is also well into development and is all about Carla preparing Sagan for his journey. She wants to make sure that Sagan is ready for his flight and is excited to send him on his way. Our third installment in the trilogy centers on Sagan as he is on the moon and is exploring its fascinating terrain. All of the books are filled with educational yet engaging material that will spark an interest with children and will also teach them about STEM and space! 


Below is the contributor's page where companies can purchase spots to sponsor us and have their logo featured at the end of the story!



Poster Design


T-Shirt Design


Our Stretch Goals


    About Us

    Earthrise Space Foundation (ESF) is a Florida-based 501(c)3 non-profit corporation dedicated to provide hands-on technical and entrepreneurial experience to students in collaboration with industry and academic institutions. The Foundation also focuses on research and development of spacecraft and spacecraft systems. We are proud to be a part of space exploration and are grateful for all of the support we have received.

    Exceeding our goal will help us provide additional internships to high school and college students, engage in new research & development space projects and impact more students via our STEM outreach programs! We hope you will join us and appreciate any size donation you can make, However, if you are a philanthropist looking to change the world and want to make a sizable donation beyond our listed amount please email Rnunez@earthrise-space.org

    To learn more about the Earthrise Space Foundation, please visit our website.

story:
From Vietnam to Bangladesh and Korea

Your giving will not be only for me and my study at Sookmyung Women’s University

My name is Bich Tran. I'm from Vietnam. I was lucky enough to study on scholarship at Asian University for Women (AUW). AUW is an international non-profit based university promoting women's higher education and leadership. I am majoring in Philosophy, Politics and Economics here.

Last summer, I worked as an intern at an NGO on development and social services. I found that good public policies and public administration are remedies for my home country's development. That influenced my decision to apply for an exchange program at Sookmyung Women's University (SMU) to study Public Administration. I believe the program will enable me to comprehend the problems and tackle them.

But, the SMU does not provide a full scholarship for living cost. I need an extra amount of $2500 for the exchange program in Seoul, Korea. 

$2200 will be for the living expenses. $300 will be for the airfare (partial).

If I study at SMU, it is an achievement as well as well as an opportunity for me and my home university.

First of all, that SMU accepts AUW students proves my university’s academic quality. That I am lucky to be one of those students also proves my ability. Thus, I can  say that this scholarship is an achievement.

Secondly, the exchange program at SMU is an opportunity. For me, it is an opportunity to study intensively and have an critical understanding about Public Administration. The knowledge will enable me to resolve existing problems in my home country.

For my home university, my study at SMU is also an opportunity. I have been an active member in AUW community. I am the Vice President of the AUW Student Government. I am also working as a resident assistant on campus. I have experience working with many other offices at AUW. Thus, I believe I will be a great AUW ambassador to SMU. Staying and studying at SMU will allow me to compare and contrast between the two universities. This will benefit AUW  applying institutions and policies from SMU which I will learn.

My story is to say that your giving will not only help me, but also my home university and my country. I will share all the knowledge, experience and skills with other students at AUW. It will also follow me through my career working in community development to bring changes to people in my home country.

You help me today, I will be able to help more people in the future.

If I do not spend the whole money, I will donate the rest  to charity organizations in Bangladesh and Vietnam.

The process will be transparent. If I use any amount of the fund for any purpose, you all will be updated.

story:
ENGLISH BELOW

TÜRKÇESİ AŞAĞIDA

En tant qu'un étudiant turc, je suis ravi de savoir que je vais bientôt passer à ma deuxième année dans un des campus délocalisés de l'Institut d'études politiques de Paris, donc de Sciences Po Paris, à Dijon. Je me suis récemment rendu compte que ma situation financière (et celle de mes parents) ne suffira pas pour la continuation de mes études ; j'ai donc besoin à la première étape d'une somme de €2440  pour les droits de scolarité.

Je suis le fils des deux professeurs à la retraite, dont le seul revenu est leur pension. Quand j'ai obtenu cette opportunité d'étudier à Sciences Po que l'on ne fais qu'une fois dans sa vie, j'ai aussitôt cherché des moyens pour financer mes études. Pour ma première année j'ai pu obtenir plusieurs bourses (une de Sciences Po et une de l'ambassade de la France en Turquie), mais elles ne couvraient pas la totalité des coûts. J'ai essayé donc de continuer avec le soutien de ma famille, mais je sens que bientôt cela ne suffira pas non plus. J'ai donc besoin au moins de trouver la somme nécessaire pour payer la reste de mes droits de scolarité, €2440, ce qui reste une somme tout de même coûteuse pour mes parents qui reçoivent leur pension en lire turque.

Toute aide ira au financement de mes droits de scolarité pour cette année. Dans l'occasion où je puisse obtenir un financement supérieur à la somme visée, je vais l'utiliser pour le coût de vie pendant mes études, pour lequel ma situation actuelle est également peu suffisante. Même si je n'atteins pas le but, toute somme aiderait à réduire le poids sur mes parents, qui m'ont déjà aidé tant.

Je vous remercie en avance pour votre générosité et pour toute aide.

***

As a Turkish student, I am delighted to know that I will soon be passing to my second year in one of the regional campuses of the Paris Institute of Political Studies, AKA Sciences Po Paris, in Dijon. However, I have recently realised that my financial situation (as well as that of my parents) will not be enough to help me go through with my studies; therefore I need, at least initially, a sum of €2440 to pay off tuition fee.

I am the son of two retired teachers, whose sole income is their pension. When I got this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to study at Sciences Po, I tried to find ways to finance my studies. For my first year I was able to obtain multiple scholarships (one from Sciences Po itself and one from the French Embassy in Turkey), but they were not enough to cover all my expenses. I then tried to go through with the help of my parents, but I sense that soon this will not suffice either. Hence I at least need to find the necessary sum to pay off what remains of my tuition fee, €2440, which is nevertheless a hefty sum for my parents who are paid for their pension in Turkish liras.

All help will go to financing this year's tuition fee. In the case that I obtain more than the sum I aim for, I will use it to cover my living costs during my studies, for which my current situation is equally difficult. Even if I do not reach the goal, any help could help me reduce the weight on the shoulders of my parents, who already helped me so much.

I thank you in advance for your generosity and for all your help.

***

Bir Türk öğrenci olarak Dijon'da, Paris Politik Bilimler Enstitüsü'nün (yani Sciences Po'nun) bölgesel kampüslerinden birinde eğitimimin ikinci yılına geçeceğimi öğrendiğim için çok mutluyum. Ancak kısa bir zaman önce farkına vardım ki ailemin ekonomik durumu eğitimime devam etmek için yetersiz kalacak; bu sebeple en azından ilk aşamada yıllık üniversite ücretini ödeyebilmek için €2440'ya ihtiyacım var.

İki emekli öğretmenin çocuğuyum ve ikisinin de tek geliri aldıkları emekli maaşları. Sciences Po'da okumak gibi hayatta sadece bir defa karşıma çıkacak bir fırsatı bulduğumda eğitimimi finanse etmek için farklı yolar aradım. İlk yılım için farklı kaynaklardan burs bulabilsem de (bir tane Sciences Po'nun kendisinden, bir tane Fransa'nın Türkiye Büyükelçiliği'nden), bunlar bütün masraflarımı karşılamak için yeterli değildi. Bunun üzerine ailemin desteğiyle ilk yılı geçirmeye çalıştım, ancak yakında bunun da mümkün olamayacağını tahmin ediyorum. Dolayısıyla yıllık ücretimden kalan miktarı (yani €2440'yu) ödemek için bir yol bulmam gerekiyor, ki bu miktar ne olursa olsun maaşını Türk Lirası olarak alan ailem için yüksek bir meblağ.

Yapacağınız bütün yardımlar yıllık ücretimin karşılanması için kullanılacak. Hedeflediğim miktarı aşmam durumunda artan parayı yıllık yaşam masraflarını karşılamak için kullanacağım (ki şu anki mali durumumda bunun için de zorlanmaktayım). Hedeflediğim miktara tam olarak ulaşamasam bile yapacağınız küçük bir yardım şu ana kadar bana fazlasıyla yardımcı olan ailemin üzerindeki yükü hafifletecektir.

Cömertliğiniz ve yapacağınız bütün yardımlar için şimdiden teşekkür ediyorum.

Detaylar

Halihazırda bir vakıftan destek bulamadın mı? Neden bunu bir vakıf üzerinden yapmıyorsun?
Özellikle mezunu olduğum Galatasaray Lisesi'nden abi ve ablalarımın soracağını tahmin ettiğim soru için cevabım şöyle:
Galatasaray Eğitim Vakfı'ndan aylık masraflarımın %60'ına denk gelen bir yardım almaktayım (Bu adreste belirtilen fiyatlara göre - İngilizce) ancak bu yıllık ücretin €2440'luk kalan miktarı ve yaklaşık €300'luk bir yaşama masrafını karşılamamın halen mümkün olmadığı anlamına geliyor. GEV şu anda verdiği miktardan daha fazlasını, özellikle Galatasaray Üniversitesi'nin restorasyonunun henüz gerçekleştirilmediği bir dönemde veremeyeceğini söyledi, ben de bunu anlayışla karşılıyor ve şu ana kadar ettikleri yardımın boyutu için müteşekkir olduğumu belirtiyorum. Ancak ortada ailemin halen karşılayamayacağı bir meblağ sözkonusu. Bu meblağı normal finansman yöntemlerinden farklı bir yapıya sahip böyle bir site üzerinden bularak vakıfın ulaşacağından farklı bir kesime ulaşabileceğimi umuyorum.

story:
The Importance of Possibility

For anything to be possible it must first be imagined. My passion in life is cultivating creativity, rooting connections and growing possibilities. As a Co-Active coach I stand on the ground that people are naturally creative, resourceful, and whole and completely capable of doing what they want to do with their lives. By rooting connections between values, ideas, actions, and dreams we grow possibilities. As a coach and optimist this is my life’s work, exploration, and the core of my campaign to raise $5,500 for the Coaches Training Institute’s Coaching Certification Program. Your support will directly contribute to the lives of those I work with, and potentially yours!

As little kids we are told that anything and everything is possible. We see our favorite super heroes flying around saving the world. In books and movies the protagonists are facing and conquering unbeliev

able odds. We believed that we too could do the impossible! Then at some point with broken bones and broken hearts we began to learn that we couldn’t fly. Maybe we were teased about our “stupid” ideas, or told that our dreams were too “unrealistic.” I’m here to make a stand for the child in each of us! Anything and everything is possible. In our history as human beings we know this to be true. The world used to be flat, women couldn’t vote, and the skies were only for birds and bugs. Look how far we’ve come and look how far we can go! 

A Snapshot of the Past to Present

In 2012 I graduated with a BFA from Rocky Mountain College of Art and Design knowing that making art, alone, was not “it” for me. I taught several art classes to young people ranging in age from 2 to 18 years old. I loved teaching the idea, “If you can imagine something, you can create it, so why not imagine big?!” Then I decided I wanted one J-O-B, full-time stability with benefits, like a “real” adult might have, and I got one. In 2013 I began working with adults with developmental disabilities and I found my real passion; seeing people for their attributes and capabilities, and reflecting their authentic power back to them. This changed the dynamic of my work environment, made my client interactions invigorating, and left me wanting more. How could I make my life around this passion and how could I share it? I had one coaching session with my amazing coach and friend Mara Connolly and knew coaching was my “it!” So far I have paid for and completed all of the courses to fill the prerequisites for certification and I’m currently building my coaching business. Throughout this journey, I have received so much love and support for all of my dreams from my family, friends, and communities.

Challenges

Being “young” has been my number one challenge in getting my business off the ground. I am simultaneously fine-tuning my coaching skills and learning how to be a small business owner. It is a pretty sharp learning curve. I have been asked and have wrestled with the question, “What could a 25 year old possibly have to give as a coach?” The answer is quite simple: I love life, I love people, I have hope, and I have skills that move people. I believe in you, your dreams, and in your capability to achieve them. Certification will make my coaching more impactful, as well as provide accreditation. 

Dreaming with Intention

I am out to empower the world one person and one small group at a time. My truth is that when people live from their authentic selves they inspire those around them to do the same. While I can never truly know what is in store for me, there are a few dreams I am working towards.

One of these dreams is to bring coaching into organizations that serve adults living with disabilities. The intention is to partner with staff and administration knowing that when people are living rooted in their values they bring purposeful living with them to work, and in turn to their clients. A large part of coaching is seeing a person as naturally creative, resourceful, and whole. I am excited to explore the ideas of wholeness within organizations that serve adults living with disabilities.

Another one of my dreams is to open a ranch serving as a completely inclusive community offering life skills workshops and camps, artist residencies, scientific and technological exploration and invention, business retreats, and sustainable agricultural endeavors. The Coaches Training Institute also offers a Leadership program that I will eventually attend. Coaching and leadership hold the founding principles of these two dreams and any “extra” money will go into a fund to support them. Your contribution not only allows me to pursue these dreams, it also builds the foundation and platform to empower (hopefully) thousands of lives.

Your Perks!

I am so excited to bring these offerings to you!

I am offering coaching and various coaching paths, a sticker, postcards, paintings, and a coloring journey! Check them out under the "perks" section.

The Money Break Down

When I donate or even pay for something I like to know where my money is going, so I thought you might as well!

$1031 - The 1st payment of the CTI Certification Program.
$2062 - The 1st and 2nd payment of the CTI Certification Program
$3093 - The 1st, 2nd, and 3rd payment of the CTI Certification Program
$4104 - The 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th  payment of the CTI Certification  Program
$5155 - The 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, and final payment of the CTI Certification Program
$5500 - All the CTI payments, Indie Gogo's 3%, and the cost of the perks 

Other Ways to Help

Spread the word! Share this campaign and the video to your friends, family, co-workers, and communities! If you know someone who might be interested in coaching, send them my way!
If you made it all the way to the bottom of this, you are a Trooper! Thank you!

story:
BECOME ONE DEGREE OF SUPPORT

For 34 years, 10,000 Degrees has been helping students from low-income backgrounds become the first in their families to graduate from college. That has started an unstoppable, growing movement for change: the I AM ONE DEGREE movement--one we hope you will join. 

Every person who donates their time or resources, everyone who supports or advises a student, each advocate for educational equity is part of this movement. Together we are creating a cycle of opportunity that ripples through communities and generations.


If you believe as we do that every student deserves an opportunity to succeed in college, there is a place for you in our movement.  Please take a moment to join our movement now by making a donation of any amount and sharing  your support by posting an #UNSelfie to #iam1degree on Facebook, Instagram or YouTube.

WHAT WE DO AT 10,000 DEGREES

Our far-reaching college opportunity program includes early college awareness programs, intensive college prep, college and financial aid counseling, mentoring, college tours, scholarships and financial aid management, and support until college graduation.

Last year, we touched 4,200 students and families through all our programs.


MORE FUNDING FOR STUDENTS
We award $2.8 million in scholarships annually to students who might not otherwise even consider college as a possibility. We also help them find additional $18 million in non-loan aid from a variety of sources. The result?  Our students take out about $1,000 in loans each year vs the $6,000 national average.

OUR IMPACT
10,000 Degrees students  graduate from college at almost three times the rate of their low-income, first-to-college peers (84% vs. 31%).

ALUMNI IMPACT

We don’t know what every one of our 18,700 alumni are doing, but we know they are changing the world through their very presence. Becoming the first in their families to graduate from college has given them the confidence and resilience to succeed in any field they choose.   Check out picture gallery (tab at top of page) of alumni, mentors and supporters to see more amazing people that make up the I AM ONE DEGREE movement.

story:
Sobre ARTHOUSE | About ARTHOUSE 

Somos 3 jóvenes arquitectos de Uruguay. En octubre de 2015 obtuvimos una mención honorífica en el concurso "3rd Earth Architecture Competition - Mud House Design 2015” organizado por NKA Foundation.

A partir de esto surge la posibilidad de la construcción de nuestro proyecto en un workshop a dictarse en Abetenim, Ghana entre el 24 de Febrero y el 25 de Mayo, 2017.

Para completar nuestro presupuesto y construir enteramente nuestro proyeto necesitamos recaudar fondos, el mismo será en su totalidad para poder construir ARTHOUSE.

_

We are 3 young architects from Uruguay. We started to work with sustainable and bio-architecture 2 years ago. We are interested in mud architecture and other alternative building systems, looking for environmental sustainability.

Last October we were awarded with an Honourable Mention in the "3rd Earth Architecture Competition - Mud House Design" organized by NKA Foundation. As a result, we were granted the opportunity to construct our project in a workshop.

El Proyecto | The Project 

ARTHOUSE en una residencia para artistas diseñada para albergar de 8 a 10 artistas. El proyecto plantea novedades técnicas, el uso de técnicas mixtas como muros de fajina y cubiertas de cerámica armada (está última desarrollada por el ingeniero uruguayo Eladio Dieste). También se proyecta el uso de un sistema alternativo de aguas servidas, asegurando así una correcta disposición final de las aguas servidas.

El proyecto plantea espacios flexibles que permiten que los artistas desarrollen sus actividades cómodamente en su estancia. Están previstos dormitorios, baños, cocina, un estar/comedor y un amplio espacio para trabajo/exposiciones que puede subdividirse con panelería móvil.

_

ARTHOUSE is a 220m² (2400sq feet) one storey artist´s residence, designed to accommodate from 8 to 10 artists. The proyect presents technical novelties, the use of mixed techniques as watlle and daub walls combined with a structural ceramic roof (developed by uruguayan engineer Eladio Dieste). It also proposes the use of alternative sewage system, ensuring a proper wastewater disposal.

The project involves flexible spaces that allow artist to develop their activities in comfort at their stay. The house has 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living/dining room and a spacious work/exhibition area that can be subdivided with mobile paneling.

Por que donar? | Why donate? 

El proyecto ARTHOUSE se concibe como una forma de construir adecuándose a los recursos locales disponibles, minimizando los materiales con alta energía incorporada. De esta forma podemos crear proyectos económicos de alta calidad arquitectónica y ambiental, capaces de ser replicados en la región del oeste africano como una alternativa duradera y respetuosa con el hábitat.

En el contexto actual de urbanización acelerada en esta región, pérdida de oficios constructivos tradicionales, en el que muchos estereotipos persisten a pesar de estar demostrada su incapacidad e in -adecuación a las realidades locales en las que se implantan, nos proponemos realizar este taller para promover la utilización de las técnicas de fajina, cerámica armada y sistemas de saneamiento alternativo en la construcción ghanesa.

Tu ayuda demostrará que estas técnicas pueden proveer una arquitectura de calidad, con una nueva estética asequible que utiliza fundamentalmente materiales naturales y locales, utilizando técnicas vernáculas que actualmente están siendo perdidas.

_

In a context of fast urbanization in west Africa, with loss of skills in arts and crafts, where many construction stereotypes persist despite their proven incapacity and inadequacy to adapt to local realities, we aim to lead the ARTHOUSE Building Workshop, so that wattle and daub, structural ceramics and alternative sewage systems techniques can be introduced in Ghanaian construction. ARTHOUSE is conceived as a building technique to be adapted to available local resources, minimizing high embodied energy materials. This way we can create high quality architecturally and environmentally friendly projects capable of being replicated in the west-African region. We believe that the lack of proper housing is not only a monetary problem (at least the main problem) but an educational one that persists because of the loss of construction knowledge and vernacular techniques.In a context of fast urbanization in west Africa, with loss of skills in arts and crafts, where many construction stereotypes persist despite their proven incapacity and inadequacy to adapt to local realities, we aim to lead the ARTHOUSE Building Workshop, so that wattle and daub, structural ceramics and alternative sewage systems techniques can be introduced in Ghanaian construction. ARTHOUSE is conceived as a building technique to be adapted to available local resources, minimizing high embodied energy materials. This way we can create high quality architecturally and environmentally friendly projects capable of being replicated in the west-African region. We believe that the lack of proper housing is not only a monetary problem (at least the main problem) but an educational one that persists because of the loss of construction knowledge and vernacular techniques.

Que destino tienen las donaciones? | Where is the money going to?

Es importante que sepas que todo el dinero recaudado se utilizará en la compra de materiales y el pago de mano de obra local que nos asistirá en la construcción de ARTHOUSE.

_

Its important that you know that all the money raised will go directly to purchase materials and pay the wages of local labour who will help us in the construction of ARTHOUSE.

story:
My name is Saoirse, I'm 16 and I grew up in Asia where my parents run a mission group called Autumn Rain International (ARI). ARI mostly helps deliver Bibles to Christians in their own language, but also helps with micro-enterprise and sponsorship programmes. I will be making a trip with my Dad to north India at the end of October.

This trip is especially significant for me because for the past year, I have been sponsoring a young girl in Nagaland, in north east India. My little sister is also sponsoring a child who I'll also be meeting. These girls were unable to attend school due to hardship. It's been wonderful to see them in their school uniforms and hearing about how they are doing well in their exams.

But recently, we got some bad news about the little girl I am sponsoring, Sarah . She got really sick with typhoid and malaria. Her personality changed from being cheerful and carefree to sad and withdrawn. The family we work with in Nagaland arranged for medical treatment for her, and it became apparent that Sarah had been sexually abused. Sarah hasn't been able to talk about it, but she's mentioned that "strange men" have been coming to the house at night. We suspect that Sarah's step-father has actually been pimping her out.

Now we are arranging for Sarah to be sponsored by our partner family. So please help me to continue to help her and to go and meet her. When Sarah heard we were coming, she was so happy. After all that she has been through, this is a significant time for us to meet.

What I Need & What You Get

So here's what I need:

* First of all, your prayer support!

* $1400.00 for my air fares

* $85.00 for my India Visa

* $200.00 for local transportation

* $200.00 for warm winter clothing and other necessary gifts we are carrying in our luggage (because posting to India is problematic)

* $115.00 for food and also the thank you gifts I plan on buying for my sponsors!

TOTAL FUND-RAISING GOAL = $2000.00

In return, you will receive a trip report with photos from me, describing all that I saw and heard. I would also like to send a special gift to those who are supporting me. 

The Impact

The impact of child sponsorship is far-reaching. Take Salome, for example. Salome is the daughter of our partner family in Nagaland. My parents sponsored Salome's education and now she has a Master's Degree in Community Development. It is Salome who actually set up the sponsorship programme through ARI that my sister and I are now sponsoring girls through. We know that assisting girls to remain in education is one of the best ways to protect them from sex trafficking, forced and early marriage, and other forms of exploitation. It is the best way to help break the cycle of poverty. Through Sarah's situation, this has become very real to us.

I am very excited about this opportunity to meet with Salome, as the team leader of the sponsorship programme, and Sarah, my sponsor girl. I hope that together, this might even be the start of helping other girls in vulnerable situations.

Thank you so much for your prayers and support!

story:
^ ^ you can use the tools above to share this campaign and spread the word ^ ^

Help us raise money for our "Investment for your future" program.

Our Story


Languatica was founded with the idea to make language learning a fun and entertaining experience for everyone. We offer programs that combine language classes with activities such as yoga, surfing, salsa dancing, sailing, tennis, golf and polo to prove that Language Learning is FUN! We offer programs in South America, North America, Europe and Asia.

Our company recently partnered with several language technology and travel start-up companies in New York City to create a more entertaining and practical language learning program which combines technology and in-country language immersion.


We are one of the British Airways Face of Opportunity Contest Winners and our company was featured and quoted in USA Today, ABC News and Global Traveler Magazine. Visit our News to take a peak!


The importance of language learning:


  • helps you to expand your view of the world

  • encourages critical reflection on the relation between language and culture, language and thought

  • expands your opportunities for meaningful leisure activities (such as travel, viewing foreign language films, watching foreign TV programs)

  • develops your intellect (encouraging good learning habits, memorization, combining course content and skills in a meaningful way)

  • improves knowledge of the native language (through comparison and contrast with the foreign language)

  • exposes you to modes of thought and viewpoints that are available only in the foreign language and its culture

  • helps to build practical skills that may be used in other disciplines

  • fosters your understanding of the interrelation between language and human nature

  • teaches and encourages respect for other ethnic groups

  • contributes to the development of your personality

  • contributes to the achievement of national goals, such as economic development or national security

  • increases your sense of self worth. Speaking Italian or Spanish to your grandmother or ordering in French at a French restaurant will do wonders for your ego!


*source: St. Johns University


Why a Scholarship fund?


Our recent survey among perspective language learners indicates  "the inability to afford language immersion trips" is the number one obstacle preventing people from engaging in immersion programs.


What We Need & What You Get


  • 100% of all contributions will go to a scholarship fund to help students with a deep passion for language learning

Scholarship recipients will be chosen based on financial need and submitted motivation letters. More details about the scholarship fund can be found here.

All names of contributors will be noted on our webpage as supporters of the project unless they choose to stay anonymous. Donors of $50+ will be matched with a scholarship recipient and will receive a personal post card from the country where the student is learning.


We want to make donating fun for everyone - so we've come up with some fun perks for our supporters. Check them out!


Other Ways You Can Help


Share the campaign with your friends and family. Help us spread our message through Twitter, Facebook and Youtube

story:
***UPDATE***

9/6/12 - There is an anonymous donor who has agreed to match $10,000 if we can raise the first $10,000 of this fundraiser. Anyone and everyone, if you can help out wherever you can, it would really help CJ and his family.  

 

Our friend CJ was recently diagnosed with Acute Myeloid Leukemia (cancer within the bone marrow) at the age of 24. He is currently at a hospital to undergo aggressive Chemotherapy Treatments where his insurance is considered out of network. The estimated cost may be well over $30,000 out of pocket for the initial chemotherapy treatmentsand some of the procedures aren't covered. 

Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is a rapid cancer that starts inside bone marrow. Persons with this type of cancer have abnormal cells inside their bone marrow. The cells grow very fast, and replace healthy blood cells. The bone marrow, which helps the body fight infections, eventually stops working correctly. Persons with AML become more prone to infections and have an increased risk for bleeding as the numbers of healthy blood cells decrease.

CJ comes from a large family of a loving mom and dad, and a total of 9 brothers and sisters. The Peterson family has given so much to people unconditionally and we would like to start a fundraiser for CJ and his family to help offset some of the costs of the medical treatments and medical expenses. It would be nice for his mom to fly to Salt Lake City to visit CJ since mom and dad lives in Chicago. 

Brad and David are great friends with CJ, and our friendship started over the sport of Triathlons. David originally didn't have any idea how to swim, CJ was an athlete that excelled in the sport of Triathlons and was able to teach David how to swim. This eventually lead to CJ Finishing the St. George Ironman in 2011 and David finishing three 140.6 mile Ironman Triathlons including last year's 2011 Ironman World Championship in Kona, Hawaii.

Brad and David have decided to race in November at Ironman Florida 2012 in honor of CJ and his battle to beat Acute Myeloid Leukemia. We hope to inspire friends, family and individuals around the world to give towards CJ's initial medical treatments of chemotherapy through his love of Triathlons.

Thank you everyone if you can be of any help.

story:
[There's been some concern that we are giving away someone elses patches as perks, but we're not! Check out the gallery to see our medic love patches. You'll have to take a training to be a medic, but there are many ways to show medic love.]

What we're up to:

The Rosehips medics are preparing for travel to offer free medical support at mass protests of the Democratic and Republican National Conventions in Charlotte, NC and Tampa, FL (Aug 27th-Sept 6th). In 2008, Collective members offered vital Good Samaritan and harm reduction care to Convention protestors—and this election year (which promises another wave of popular protest) the Rosehips will again present basic assessment, first aid, and emergency services free-of-charge in the streets.

 Depending on funds raised, we will send between 4 and 8 highly-trained and experienced Street Medics* to the East Coast. In addition to hundreds of dollars individual Rosehips are committing to this Convention season, the group needs to raise a minimum of $2000 in travel expenses. Without contributions now, some of us will be forced to reconsider our plans in light of survival needs (like rent), which could mean fewer queer medics in the streets and wellness spaces of Charlotte and Tampa this year.

 [In the highly unlikely event that we over-fundraise for our travel needs this Convention season, we will use the funds for any legal needs (eg. bail, citations, replacing damaged/confiscated equipment, court expenses, etc.) that arise for us, or we will contribute to legal funds of other medics and high-risk (People of Color, LGBTQ, undocumented, etc) individuals.]

Who we are:

The Rosehip Medic Collective is a group of volunteer, primarily queer-identified Street Medics* and healthcare activists based in Portland, Oregon. We provide first aid and emergency care at protests, direct actions, encampents, and other sites of resistance and struggle. We have also trained hundreds of other street medics and put on community wellness trainings for activists from houseless, queer, forest defense, student, economic justice, and other communities. We believe in democratizing healthcare knowledge and skills, in reducing dependence on corporate medicine, and that strong networks of support and care are essential to building sustainable, long-term movements for all liberatory struggles.

As medics, we work to create one facet of the healthy and diverse infrastructure we believe necessary to sustaining social justice movements and building a better world. Our group includes EMTs, Wilderness First Responders, herbalists, community educators and more. To request our group’s support at an action/event—or for information about our group, medical support, and trainings, please visit www.rosehipmedics.org

What's a “Street Medic”?*

Street Medics have been a regular feature of grassroots social justice movements since the Mississippi Freedom Summer of 1964, when doctors, nurses and students marched in solidarity with Civil Rights protestors and offered free Good Samaritan care. While local Emergency Medical Services (EMS) reguarly play a part in government response to large protests, police regularly withhold ambulance crews where they see an interest in controlling or arresting crowds. Add to this the expense and sometimes-frightening experience of seeking conventional emergency response, and many people choose to go without cruical first aid and aftercare—or to stay home. Past mass mobilizations in Denver, Pittsburgh and elsewhere have seen collaboration between Street Medics and city EMS. Most recently street medics joined with social justic-inclined healthcare practitioners across North America to support local “Occupy!” activists, campers, and visitors.

 

Help send the Rosehip Medics to Charlotte and Tampa!

story:
Albert Einstein once quoted that "Imagination is more important than knowledge." Imagination requires one to push the boundaries of the rhetorical left hemisphere of the brain into the right hemisphere where creativity expands beyond the limits of mediocrity and conformity. It allows individual growth through self discovery and mastery essential for peak performace while aiding society as a whole in maintaining order and balance in the world. Nowhere is imagination appreciated more than the arts and entertainment industries.

THEATRE * STAGE * VOCALS * DANCE

  

Our Story

Youth in the Arts-IMAGINE (YITA-IMAGINE) a 501(c)(3) Non-Profit Corporation and founded in April 2010 by Sheba Brown is based on the belief that attention to our youth needs to be of the utmost importance and we are committed to meeting those needs through the introduction and development of art education.  With limited resources available in schools today for arts programming and curriculum, YITA-IMAGINE combines the elements of personal growth and self-development, with artistic expression as a way to build self-esteem, spirit and self-confidence among youth as well as adults by demonstrating all of the positive qualities viewed in the various arts.  The goal is to positively transform youth while providing an excitingly needed platform for showcasing and nurturing young talent. Throughout the year youth and adults attend YITA-IMAGINE workshops to hone skills and learn new artistic disciplines from professionals in their areas of expertise such as theater, dance, fashion, music, film and stage production. 


In the fall of 2010 Youth In the Arts-IMAGINE provided introduction and training in all areas of the arts with it's One Day Boot Camps at the 4-H Conference Center, NCCF and Youth in the Arts-IMAGINE, Inc. and also, provided public workshops for registered participants, students and art professionals at BDIGI Studios in Wash., DC hosted by iCue Music Group formerly, 855 MUSIC GROUP.


In 2013 YITA began providing after school educational programming to fill the void public schools are lacking in arts instruction and creative curricula. Originally, a volunteer program, YITA has grown into a functioning 501(c)3 organization that seeks to hire competent instructors and produce creative curricula to engage and inspire youth to reach their highest potential within and outside of the classroom.

ARTS & CRAFTS

COLOR BLOCKING & JEWELRY MAKING

  

MUSIC

 

FASHION DESIGN  

HAIR & MAKEUP STYLING

 

While our current public school system offers fewer choices for our youth to explore their creativity in a regular classroom setting, there is a growing interest in the arts heightened by an explosion of popular media programming with great emphasis on creative endeavors. More significant is the emerging high numbers of passionate arts entrepreneurs supported by advanced, cost effective and efficient technology that allows the individual to express their creativity over various social platforms from Instagram to Youtube.  Yet there is very little harnessing of the creative genius in K-12 primary educational schooling.

PERFORMANCE & TEAMWORK

MARTIAL ARTS - HEALING ARTS - DISCIPLINE & FOCUS 

 

  

FUN * GAMES * FITNESS

YITA offers youth ages 5 yrs. old to adults an array of arts and entertainment instruction that teaches the creative and technical aspects of these industries including but not limited to: 

event production * film directing * producing * different forms of media writing

FILM & LANGUAGE

Additionally, YITA uses a creative learning model in summer school programming that engages youth in three project-based learning components: developing employable skills, work readiness training and leadership skills building and critical thinking needed to be successful in any workplace.  

Each period of instruction is culminated with a major production allowing all participants to demonstrate their talent on stage to a large audience of family and friends.  Demographically, YITA's emphasis is on serving at-risk youth located in the  Greater Washington Metropolitan Area, however, we also offer our broad programming to striving youth outside of this population and look to expand our territory to locations in various parts of the country.

EMPLOYMENT DEVELOPMENT

 


What We Have Accomplished

Already just over 3 years, YITA has served approximately 300 youth and over 50 adults. We've also witnessed the impact YITA has already made on returning youth, who've demonstrated remarkable improvement in their attitudes, freedom of creative expression, etiquette and classroom attentiveness. Their enthusiasm and performance skills have grown from the time they've entered until the time they've exited as witnessed by evaluations and the quality of production of a culminating performance managed and produced by the youth and staff.

PARTY DAY 

 PIZZA*GAMES*STORYTELLING*FACE PAINTING 

 

All of this has been possible due to our talented and dedicated Sr. & Jr. Staff Members who range in ages 14 yrs. old and up.

 

  

   

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $79,000 or more in funds to service 50 or more youth in the After School Programming and return to The National Center for Children and Families (NCCF) community of homeless residents, disadvantaged and abused victims to host a few of our One Day Art Boot Camps ("IMAGINE"). (view video) 

The funding is needed for the following: instruction supplies such as uniform T-shirts for staff and students; art, office and classroom supplies (notebooks, pens, printer ink, paper, pencils, paint, brushes, canvas, fabric, etc.); technical equipment (photo and video cameras, film projectors, sound system rental, walkie talkies, etc.);  instructor training (creative curriculum such as the Institute of Noetic Sciences (IONS) Creative Worldview curriculum in Petaluma, California); written materials (books, printed handouts and promotional materials) program production fees (costuming, food & snacks and stage props, etc.); youth employment (stipends and compensation for certain positions); and venue rental fees for off campus workshops. Our difficulty is not finding students but securing the finances to support our very unique programming. Although we are soliciting grantors for funding, the process is arduously long and without a paid full-time grants writer, we have fallen short of our fiscal goal.

If we don't reach our goal, we will use whatever funds collected in one of the above areas.  If we're fortunate enough to exceed our goal we will be able to use those funds to re-introduce Youth in the Arts Day "IMAGINE" our One Day Boot Camp. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Use your imagination to help us raise funds. Donate funds and post a photo or video of you holding your personal creative sign using one of our group names  "peace" "love" "journey" "destiny" and "spirit," or just post a one line statement on our Facebook page. Make sure you let us know your location. Share and ask others to do the same and we'll show the world how using our imagination can create the change we want to see in the world through the arts.

Remember the "Art of Giving" can heal, thrill and send love and care to others! 

Use one of the perks below for yourself, a friend or to "Pass it Forward"

 
ART OF GIVING

Blankets * YITA T-shirts * Color Blocking T-Shirts, Jewelry * Hand Puppets 

Maddie's Blankets Founder Madeline Pelgrim (teenager on left).    

If you've made it this far, thanks for reading! Whether you are able or unable to back us financially, you can also, help us by sharing this page on facebook or twitter! 

PLEASE DON'T DENY OUR CHANCE TO CONTINUE SHARING OUR TALENTS, KNOWLEDGE AND GIFTS ESPECIALLY, WITH TODAY'S YOUTH!!!!!

We want to complete our fundraising within two months to prepare for Spring sessions.  


Please Help Us Achieve Our Goal and keep the smiles on these young faces!!!!!

story:
Our Story 

Last year for the Australian summer Christmas season, some friends, family and I hosted a festive mud themed event for the local community similar to others held in Australia, the USA and Mexico over the last 10yrs (www.mudsunfun.org). A few dozen people of all ages from great grandparents to toddlers participated as either audience members, bare foot mud stompers, mud blob passers, mud brick builders, percussionists and food servers. We built sun dried earthen mud brick masonry walls on top of a stone foundation and later some of us covered ourselves with mud and paraded through town to the local fresh water swimming hole. We began building the walls for a small dwelling "cubby house" structure. 

This coming summer I plan to return and spend time making sure that people know whatever they need to know to continue this kind of stuff in their community.  We will go through the hows and whys of engaging the community through festive summer building event/s and will we transform the labor intensive ï¿½workï¿½ into fun, desirable ï¿½playï¿½.  An instructional video (DVD) will be made for others to replicate our successes. Creative forms of self expression will be added to the mix to help blur the lines between work and play.

The Impact   Trainees will learn new skills, set new precedents and be instilled with pride. They will be trained to use art and performances to bring together the community. They will also be taught skills that will be applied to help build a unique structure and to create a blueprint that will be made available to everyone. Students will learn how to organize and host a community event, how to build a functional dwelling structure with local ingredients, and how to document what they have learned. The festive events are designed to create an interactive community experience like no other and the completed structures are highly worthy of merit. In addition to their structural integrity and artistic appeal they are made from low cost, locally excavated and harvested materials that do not require burning fossil fuels and thereby surpass the most sustainable best practices. The completed structure will add to the legacy of the natural building traditions from around the world which are being revived for their many benefits, and bring to light the glory of other structures built from sun dried earthen masonry, that have been in continuous use for many centuries and withstood the test of time. These include the Taos Pueblos of New Mexico, the cities of Djenne and Timbuktu in Mali, Shibam of Yemen, Devon England and the Fujian Tulou of China..

Funds will be used to transfer knowledge and skills to the community through training local youth and ensuring their educational work experience is of the highest quality possible.


This is how the money will be spent. It will be used to:

-Pay myself a trainers fee (TBD)
-Pay a stipend for 3 youth leaders to complete training (TBD)
-Hire the following local professionals:
        1. Drummer - to create rhythm for the event and rehearse the performance (TBD)
        2. Choreographer- to create a dance performance to blur the lines between work and play (TBD)
        3.Wood Expert/s  -to harvest a tree and mill it into lumber and build a roof (TBD)
        4.Videographer - to create an instructional video. (TBD)


& What You Get -What we can offer for your donation:

-thanks for supporting a great project with a good cause
 -admission to the unique, fun, family events
-strengthened sense of community
-new skills in natural building
-event themed T-shirt 
-mud facials and full body mud baths
-your business promoted via the project
 -input into deciding which youth are selected for the training/job
-be the one to carry the torch and host the next building project at your site. This includes training/coaching on how to organize your own project like this.
story_txt:
Our Story  
Last
 year for the Australian summer Christmas season, some friends, family 
and I hosted a festive mud themed event for the local community similar to others held in Australia, the USA and Mexico over the last 10yrs (www.mudsunfun.org). A few 
dozen people of all ages from great grandparents to toddlers participated as either audience members, bare foot mud stompers, mud blob passers, mud brick builders, percussionists and food servers. We built sun 
dried earthen mud brick masonry walls on top of a stone foundation and later some of us 
covered ourselves with mud and paraded through town to the local fresh 
water swimming hole. We began building the walls for a small dwelling "cubby house" structure. This
 coming summer I plan to return and spend time making sure that people know whatever they need to know to continue this kind of stuff in their community.  We will go through the hows and whys of engaging the community through festive summer building event/s and will we transform the labor intensive 
ï¿½workï¿½ into fun, desirable ï¿½playï¿½.  An instructional video (DVD) will be made for others to replicate our successes. Creative forms of self expression will be added to the mix to help blur the lines between work and play.
The Impact   Trainees will learn new skills, set new precedents and be 
instilled with pride. They will be trained to use art and performances to bring together the 
community. They will also be taught skills that will be applied to help build a unique structure and to create a blueprint that will be made available to everyone. Students will learn how to organize and host a community event, how to build a functional dwelling structure with local ingredients, and how to document what they have learned. The festive events are designed to create an interactive community experience like no other and the 
completed structures are highly worthy of merit. In addition to their 
structural integrity and artistic appeal they are made from low cost, 
locally excavated and harvested materials that do not require burning 
fossil fuels and thereby surpass the most sustainable best practices. The completed structure will add to the legacy of the natural building traditions from around 
the world which are being revived for their many benefits, and bring to 
light the glory of other structures built from sun dried earthen masonry, 
that have been in continuous use for many centuries and withstood the 
test of time. These include the Taos Pueblos of New Mexico, the cities 
of Djenne and Timbuktu in Mali, Shibam of Yemen, Devon England and the 
Fujian Tulou of China..

story:
Our Story


This effort is to support development and expression in the arts according to the values of Torah. The values of Torah are our lifestyle and the arts are our language.

What we DO


Currently, we have an upcoming weekend of the Arts for women planned for

February 11-12

, which will feature top observant female performing & media artists in music, theater, dance and film, offer classes in these mediums, and facilitate networking for observant creative professionals.

In general, through a monthly newsletter & this weekend, we
â€¢Promote the work of artists living an observant lifestyle
â€¢Encourage the creation of new work with community-appropriate messages
â€¢Facilitate skills development in music composition, dance, choreography, acting, or any art form of choice in order to grow personally, refine natural abilities, and be able to deliver beautiful, meaningful products of high quality
â€¢Showcase the most current work and artists each year to create new and ongoing standards of excellence for the future

Why Donate


â€¢To help the wonderful gift of creativity be developed and used, cultivated and increased
â€¢To help each person discover and reach the potential they have to bring new music, thought, and beauty into the world
â€¢We need the support for the creation and promotion of our programs and for the people behind the programs!
â€¢Fully tax deductible! :)

THANK YOU SO MUCH!

May your life be enriched with music, creative thought and productivity.

________________________________________________________________________
*Examples of legal standards applicable to creative expression are:
1. Observance of Shabbat
2. Material/content alligned with Jewish values
3. An all female setting for female performing artists
