story:
My name is Morriah Young and I am a sophomore theatre focus at The University of the Arts, here in Philadelphia. I major in Directing, Play-writing and Production and minor in Musical Theatre. As an artist and student I believe it is important to study abroad to get a wider understanding of my chosen career path. At my University the specific study abroad program I chose to participate in is during winter break. Since this specific study abroad program is during winter break and not during a fall or spring semester the cost is separate from my tuition. However, this program allows me to get three credits and the experience of a life time. The trip is all inclusive and so the total cost of the trip is not unreasonable in anyway. The cost covers airfare, housing, meals, tours, theatre productions, workshops and more. The total cost of the trip is $3200. I already paid a non-refundable security deposit of $500 which was deducted from the total amount. This leaves me with a balance of $2700.  Unfortunately, I do not have enough funding to support my travels and it is with great humility that ask for the generosity and support of you to help me reach my goal. I am currently working two jobs as well keeping up with my studies in school. Even with working I still will not raise enough to pay for off the remaining balance for the trip. Please read my story and find it within the deepest depths of your heart to donate anything you are lead to contribute. Please also spread the word. Any little amount helps. Small donations can go a long way. Thank You, with all sincerity. 


The only place I know is Philadelphia. It has been my home and my world for as long as I can remember. I grew up here, attended elementary school, middle school and high school right here in Philly. As the years have passed, my love for this place has grown tenacious and perpetual. After years of growing up in this familiar place I find myself attending college here as well. Philadelphia is a beautiful and resourceful place to explore your craft, define your talent and examine your growth as an artist; in spite of the city being a home for my heart it desires a holiday. I have never been out of the country, let alone off of the East Coast. And what better a place than London to be my first experience out of the Country? I want to take advantage of this opportunity while it is in front of me because I know there may be a chance of it never presenting itself to me again. Sure, I could easily turn down this opportunity and decide to go another year but who’s to say that year will come? One year may turn into two, and those two years could multiply. I have been in Philadelphia my entire life, and I know I will be here for the rest of my college experience. Seizing this opportunity will allow me to embark on a journey that will be life changing in every artistic approach possible. 

  Studying abroad increases confidence, exposure and experience within the arts. Whether, a performing artist or a visual artist, traveling helps open the mind to a world of new possibilities for craft. Studying abroad strengthens tenacity both personally and professionally. It will help me gain an appreciation and better understanding for a foreign culture, prepares me to work in a diverse and international work place, and help expand my cross-cultural problem solving and communication skills. All of these points circle back to the arts and the importance of having the experience of another place; it’ll allow me to experience something new within my art.

  Directing, Playwriting and Production (DPP) is a one of a kind type of major. It is the only department in the country that allows me to have several focuses, yet somehow still allows me to have that one main focus. DPP is a combination of directing, playwriting, stage managing and producing. This department provides me with a broad understanding of the technical aspects of theatre and the pieces that help bring the stage life. Directing, Playwriting and Production allows artists, such as myself to have all the necessary skills to survive in the theatre world by pushing us not only to our full potential but past it. While studying abroad in London I expect to be exposed to a new culture. I will learn about the history of art there and the current art that is being created. I expect to learn a new dialect, a different way of speaking and be able to communicate and learn new ways of living.

  Studying abroad will give me a chance to spread my wings and fly. I’ve been a bird in the same tree my entire life and now I think I should leave the nest. Studying abroad will broaden my scope not only just within the arts but within life itself. It will give me an opportunity to see theatre in a different place and understand the how their technique can be different and can be the same. Not only is it something that will be good for me personally and academically but it is also something that will build my resume and my experience within my chosen profession.  London will be a great experience for me and I know it will forever have an impact on the work and art that I create.
story_txt:
My name is Morriah Young and I am a sophomore theatre focus at The University of the Arts, here in Philadelphia. I major in Directing, Play-writing and Production and minor in Musical Theatre. As an artist and student I believe it is important to study abroad to get a wider understanding of my chosen career path. At my University the specific study abroad program I chose to participate in is during winter break. Since this specific study abroad program is during winter break and not during a fall or spring semester the cost is separate from my tuition. However, this program allows me to get three credits and the experience of a life time. The trip is all inclusive and so the total cost of the trip is not unreasonable in anyway. The cost covers airfare, housing, meals, tours, theatre productions, workshops and more. The total cost of the trip is $3200. I already paid a non-refundable security deposit of $500 which was deducted from the total amount. This leaves me with a balance of $2700.  Unfortunately, I do not have enough funding to support my travels and it is with great humility that ask for the generosity and support of you to help me reach my goal. I am currently working two jobs as well keeping up with my studies in school. Even with working I still will not raise enough to pay for off the remaining balance for the trip. Please read my story and find it within the deepest depths of your heart to donate anything you are lead to contribute. Please also spread the word. Any little amount helps. Small donations can go a long way. Thank You, with all sincerity. 

The only place I know is Philadelphia. It has been my home and my world for as long as I can remember. I grew up here, attended elementary school, middle school and high school right here in Philly. As the years have passed, my love for this place has grown tenacious and perpetual. After years of growing up in this familiar place I find myself attending college here as well. Philadelphia is a beautiful and resourceful place to explore your craft, define your talent and examine your growth as an artist; in spite of the city being a home for my heart it desires a holiday. I have never been out of the country, let alone off of the East Coast. And what better a place than London to be my first experience out of the Country? I want to take advantage of this opportunity while it is in front of me because I know there may be a chance of it never presenting itself to me again. Sure, I could easily turn down this opportunity and decide to go another year but who’s to say that year will come? One year may turn into two, and those two years could multiply. I have been in Philadelphia my entire life, and I know I will be here for the rest of my college experience. Seizing this opportunity will allow me to embark on a journey that will be life changing in every artistic approach possible. 
  Studying abroad increases confidence, exposure and experience within the arts. Whether, a performing artist or a visual artist, traveling helps open the mind to a world of new possibilities for craft. Studying abroad strengthens tenacity both personally and professionally. It will help me gain an appreciation and better understanding for a foreign culture, prepares me to work in a diverse and international work place, and help expand my cross-cultural problem solving and communication skills. All of these points circle back to the arts and the importance of having the experience of another place; it’ll allow me to experience something new within my art.
  Directing, Playwriting and Production (DPP) is a one of a kind type of major. It is the only department in the country that allows me to have several focuses, yet somehow still allows me to have that one main focus. DPP is a combination of directing, playwriting, stage managing and producing. This department provides me with a broad understanding of the technical aspects of theatre and the pieces that help bring the stage life. Directing, Playwriting and Production allows artists, such as myself to have all the necessary skills to survive in the theatre world by pushing us not only to our full potential but past it. While studying abroad in London I expect to be exposed to a new culture. I will learn about the history of art there and the current art that is being created. I expect to learn a new dialect, a different way of speaking and be able to communicate and learn new ways of living.
  Studying abroad will give me a chance to spread my wings and fly. I’ve been a bird in the same tree my entire life and now I think I should leave the nest. Studying abroad will broaden my scope not only just within the arts but within life itself. It will give me an opportunity to see theatre in a different place and understand the how their technique can be different and can be the same. Not only is it something that will be good for me personally and academically but it is also something that will build my resume and my experience within my chosen profession.  London will be a great experience for me and I know it will forever have an impact on the work and art that I create.

story:
Dear Friends,

Ever since the tragic shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School, where many of my neighbors were lost to a senseless act of violence, I have become passionate about reducing the epidemic of gun deaths in this country. I am working with a grassroots group called the Newtown Action Alliance to make sure that the Sandy Hook tragedy results in changes that make our schools and communities safer.  As a part of this strategy, the NAA organizes trips to Washington DC every three months to meet with lawmakers and the media to keep the issue of gun violence in the forefront.

I would like to go with the NAA to DC on September 17th-18th for the 9 month anniversary of the shooting.  And I would like to bring a gun violence victim, survivor or family member from another part of the country, with me.

It will cost approx. $500 to send me and a colleague from another community to DC for this trip so that our voices can be heard, and so we make sure that they do not forget.

I have pledged to raise money to help pay our way and I am asking for your support.   Even a small donation of $12.14 would be a helpful symbolic gesture. $26.00 would be even more symbolic and helpful.  Really, any amount you can offer would be terrific and very much appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your support of this important cause.   Please email me at ginamcdade@gmail.com if you have any questions.

Thank you for your support,

Gina McDade

Sandy Hook, CT

PS.  Here is a link to the NAA website for more info:  www.newtownaction.org

Here is a link to a video from the last trip to DC in June for the six month anniversary:  http://www.theday.com/article/20130614/MEDIA0101/130619786

story:
The Human Rights and Globalization Law Review at Howard University School of Law works to enhance scholarly dialogue on various issues related to humanity, equal justice, social policy, and worldwide development.  We are writing to request your participation as a sponsor of Volumes 5 and 6 of our publication.  As a student-run organization we are always looking for new and creative ways to produce beneficial scholarship for our subscribers.  With your help, we can ensure that Howard University School of Law can continue to be a beacon, not only for civil rights, but also for human rights.

This year, the Law Review plans to publish several fascinating articles and notes.  Topics will span from the necessity of a 21st century human rights movement in the United States, to civilian safety during foreign intervention, and modern genocide.  These articles promise to be timely as well as engaging.  We are working extremely hard to ensure that the volumes in our stewardship will be of the highest quality.

There is much work to be done.  This year marks the 20th year our publication has been serving the Howard University School of Law community.  We plan to host a roundtable, reach out to the public beyond campus, and most importantly, publish articles that will inspire.  Please join us in this effort and make a donation.

Thank you in advance.

story:
Short Summary

Moved by the yearning for better education amongst the youth that could not otherwise afford high school fees in urban areas, we started Star of the land academy with the sole purpose to provide these youth with better education. The academy comprises orphaned children who are about 30%, and non orphans with huge financial struggles to afford basic education. The core wishes of the institution were to have; proper building structures, text books, laboratory, computers, sporting goods, electricity, food, and clean water. This has partially been realized since the academy was founded 10 years ago in 2003. Today the community boasts of well disciplined children with very good academic records that is evidenced from the Zonal and District exams. We have 7th grade as the highest  class, and we will be sitting for our very first national exam next year 2014.  The total number of children is 120, supported by a nine members staff team. Thanks to all the communal support we receive from the parents and the community at large. The institution is however faced with financial burden of supporting these children, especially the orphans who have none to look up to except you out there willing to hold their hands. While the intention and wish to support these children is very much real and alive, we are faced with the hard reality, that we dearly need you  to hold our hands. We are very much in need of basic education facilities. Not everybody is blessed financially to support us, but we do thank you in advance for taking time to get to know us. Please spread the word through this web page, facebook, word of mouth or any other way possible. Blessings.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The children of Star of the land academy dearly need your helping hand to help them realize their academic dreams. We will be very much grateful for  any  assistance towards achieving the basic education facilities. We thank you in advance even for the desire to help. We put the goal at US$12,000 which equals to ksh 1 million, that is meant for the above materials. If you are able to personally visit our school, feel more than welcomed. Our staff team are willing to shake your hand for a word of thank you. We appreciate whichever kind or form of assistance with which you bless this institution. Blessings.

 

The Impact

This campaign aims at reaching somebody out there willing to sacrifice to help us attain a better education at the Star of the land academy. People do not always help because they have an abundance, but due to sacrifice for a better end result. If only we could get better structures, text books, a source of light for studies, and clean water, Star of the land will be  an academic beacon to the community. We have the potential to compete with national schools in Kenya, but we do dearly need the basic education facilities.  I, Stephen started a youth group in our village called Homa Youth back in 2003, which has tremendously helped the other youth in the community. I still believe that my good and sincere intentions for this school, will touch someone out there to hold the hands of these children. A voice from Star calls for you to give them a chance for better education. Blessings. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We are aware of the financial limitations of other people who would otherwise support us, but please word of mouth, this web page,  prayers, visits, and any kind of advise toward our educational success will be very much appreciated. Thank you and thank you indeed. Blessings.

story:
Overview

NOTE: You CAN donate any amount, large or small, and regardless of whether or not you have a child to recite the ABC's for you.

The goal of this fundraiser is to raise enough money to have a meaningful impact in helping the families of the victims. Ideally, $500-$1,000 for each of the families would at least help offset some of the burial costs.

The 26 letters of the alphabet are representative of the 26 victims killed inside the school.

Please view videos that have been uploaded by parents and children in support of the effort here:

http://www.indiegogo.com/alphabet26?c=gallery

Though some other options are appearing for donations I felt that Alphabet 26 could be a better way of getting children and adults more 'actively' involved.

Once the fundraiser is completed, money will be donated evenly across all families by identifying a single next of kin or designated beneficiary OR by donating to a third-party organization with a verifiable and transparent method for distribution.

After the fundraiser is completed a determination will be made regarding the best method for distribution. Within two weeks of the completion of the fundraiser an announcement will be made to share the method of distribution and the date of distribution.

Please Share Videos If You Can

I thought it would be an incredible sign of support if you could have any children that recite their ABC's tape it on video and post the video link in the comments for this fundraiser on IndieGoGo. This is Eden, sharing her ABC's and her support... http://youtu.be/n3y09fh3gRM

If you do post a video, please feel free to post it with the first name of the child [NO LAST NAMES PLEASE!], age of the child and the state you live in.

So it would look like this:

[YOUR VIDEO LINK] Kate, 6 from Minnesota

About

I am sharing a few details below only for the purpose of establishing credibility and earning your trust in processing these donations. After all, no reasonably responsible person would donate without an assurance that the donations will be managed appropriately.

  • My name is Jason Small
  • I am 36 years old
  • I live in New Jersey
  • I work professionally in digital communications and here is my LinkedIn profile: www.linkedin.com/in/profilejasonsmall/
  • Here is my Twitter profile: https://twitter.com/digitalscenejay
  • Here is my Facebook profile: http://www.facebook.com/JasonCaineSmall
  • I was brought to tears several times while reading about the events over the past few days, even though I do not have children
  • I donated to the Emilie Parker Fund (http://www.facebook.com/EmilieParkerFund) but felt this was not enough
  • During church, I had this crazy idea and I would rather try and fail than miss an opportunity to help these families; lives were lost and my pride is irrelevant
  • I am open to comments, suggestions, critiques and thoughts on improving this effort in the best way possible to make it successful and an appropriate fit during such a difficult time for all of the families involved

No Matter Where You Do It, Please Donate

If my information isn't enough to establish credibility and trust, then please find another way to help support the families.

Visit the CNN page here:

http://www.cnn.com/2012/12/15/us/iyw-help-for-victims-of-sandy-hook-shooting/index.html?hpt=hp_t1

I also found another resourceful article here:

http://www.dailycamera.com/breaking-news/ci_22199597/connecticut-school-shooting-how-help-victims-families
